0.title: CBSE forms panel after complaints of wrong answer key in Class 10 Odia exam
0.article_body: CBSE has decided to constitute an expert committee after it received complaints from a school that the answer key of the Odia Language paper in the Term-1 Class 10 board exams was fractionally "wrong". CBSE further said, "An appropriate decision will be taken by the Board within 24 hours, on the basis of the report of the expert committee."

1.title: Pant is best wicketkeeper in terms of having impact on game: Parthiv
1.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said Rishabh Pant has consistently improved his wicketkeeping. He added Pant is among the top three Indian wicketkeepers in terms of batting ability. "If it's about having...impact on...game, then Pant is currently the best wicketkeeper," Parthiv stated. Pant scored the fastest fifty by an Indian in Test cricket in the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka.

2.title: SP ally RLD dissolves all its units, frontals in Uttar Pradesh
2.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) announced to "dissolve" its units (state, regional and district) and frontals in Uttar Pradesh "with immediate effect" on Monday. The party said that the directions for this order have been given by its national president Jayant Chaudhary. RLD contested the recent UP state Assembly elections in an alliance with the Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party.

3.title: Chennai Metro opens 2 new stations in phase-1 extension stretch
3.article_body: Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) opened the Tiruvottiyur Theradi and Wimco Nagar Depot stations in phase-1 extension between Washermanpet and Wimco Nagar on Sunday. Commuters will also be able to park their vehicles at Wimco Nagar metro station free of charge till March 31, CMRL said. Phase-1 metro line consists of two corridors, Washermanpet-Chennai Airport and Chennai Central-St Thomas Mount.

4.title: Was ragged in school, was told 'Your dad wears sunglasses at night': Bappi's son
4.article_body: Late musician Bappi Lahiri's son Bappa Lahiri in an interview revealed that he used to get ragged in school because of his father's sunglasses. "People said, 'Oh, your father wears sunglasses at night, he can't see etc'," he added. "Today it's become like a trend. He never went by the book when it came to style," Bappa further said.

5.title: Meta prohibits calls for death of a head of state amid Russia-Ukraine war
5.article_body: Meta clarified on Sunday that it's not allowing posts calling for the death of a head of state in context of Russian invasion of Ukraine, Reuters reported citing President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg. This comes after Meta allowed some posts seeking the death of Russian President Vladimir Putin. "We are not condoning violence against Russians in general," Clegg wrote.

6.title: Clash between SP and BJP supporters leads to stone-pelting in UP; 10 booked
6.article_body: A political argument between supporters of Samajwadi Party and BJP led to a clash and stone-pelting in Uttar Pradesh, police said. According to police, an FIR was registered against 10 persons and three of them were detained in this connection. "Four police teams were rushed to the spot to contain the situation. Those involved...managed to escape," a police officer said.

7.title: Take responsibility for Uttarakhand defeat, apologised to members: Harish
7.article_body: Congress leader and former Uttarakhand Chief Minister Harish Rawat said that he takes responsibility for Congress' defeat in the Uttarakhand Assembly elections. "All of us thought that we were winning in Uttarakhand...I apologised to every member and leadership in the working committee. I have also apologised to the public before," Rawat said.

8.title: British Academy Film Awards pay tribute to Lata Mangeshkar in 'In Memoriam'
8.article_body: The late singer Lata Mangeshkar was featured in the 'In Memoriam' segment at the 2022 edition of the British Academy of Film and Television Awards. The tribute described her as "an Indian playback singer, who recorded an estimated 25,000 songs for more than 1,000 Hindi films over a career spanning 70 years". She passed away aged 92 on February 6.

9.title: Cong leaders don't have courage to make party Gandhi-mukt: BJP MP
9.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi has taken a dig at the Congress by saying that "Congress leaders don't have the courage to make their party Gandhi-mukt". "Drowned in corruption and dynastic politics, Congress has been pretending to brainstorm for the past many years," Modi said in a reference to Congress' defeat in the recent five state Assembly elections.

10.title: Sensex ends 935 points higher at 56,486, Nifty settles at 16,871
10.article_body: The Sensex on Monday climbed 935 points or 1.68% to settle at 56,486, while Nifty 50 jumped 241 points or 1.45% higher to close at 16,871. While Infosys was the top Nifty gainer as it rose close to 4%, Paytm shares fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE on Monday.

11.title: Not a VIP, won't be given special facilities in jail: Court denies home food for Chitra
11.article_body: A Delhi court remarked that former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is "not a VIP" and won't be provided special facilities during her 14-day judicial custody. Denying her home-cooked food, it said, "There are inmates who are in their 70s, who eat Tihar jail food. I have myself eaten Tihar...food. It’s good...VIP prisoners want everything...Every accused, every prisoner is the same."

12.title: 2 dead after shell hits residential building in Ukraine: Official
12.article_body: At least two people have died and three were hospitalised after a shell hit a nine-storey residential building in Ukraine's Kyiv on Monday, Internal Affairs adviser Anton Gerashchenko said. The fire was extinguished at 7.58 am, emergency services said. This comes as Ukraine's Deputy PM announced that they'll try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors the same day.

13.title: Excited to get started with MI, looks very close-knit team: Archer
13.article_body: England pacer Jofra Archer, who was bought by MI for ₹8 crore in the IPL mega auction, has said he's really excited to get started with the franchise. "MI looks very close-knit and family-oriented and such teams always do well," he stated. Archer is likely to miss the upcoming season and feature for the franchise in IPL 2023.

14.title: 15-year-old girl gang-raped near Ahmedabad, 8 men arrested
14.article_body: Eight men were arrested on Sunday for allegedly abducting and raping a 15-year-old girl on the outskirts of Ahmedabad. According to police, the girl was brought to a secluded area by the main accused, where he had also called seven of his friends. She was then taken near a boring well where the eight men forced themselves upon her.

15.title: NASA shares pic of infant star's energetic outburst, says 'A star is born'
15.article_body: NASA has shared the picture of an energetic outburst from an infant star captured by the Hubble Space Telescope. Sharing the picture on Twitter, NASA tweeted, "A star is born." NASA explained, "This stellar tantrum, produced by an extremely young star in the earliest phase of formation, consists of an incandescent jet of gas travelling at supersonic speeds."

16.title: Singer Kanika Kapoor to get married second time in May: Report
16.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, known for her song 'Baby Doll', will be getting married to NRI businessman Gautam in May, reported ETimes. This will be the singer's second marriage. She was earlier married to NRI businessman Raj Chandok and got divorced in 2012. Kanika and Gautam have reportedly been dating for a year and their wedding will take place in London.

17.title: No COVID-19 death reported in Navi Mumbai in March so far
17.article_body: No COVID-19 death was reported in the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) in March so far. The civic body saw death due to COVID-19 last time on February 26. The city has so far reported 2,049 COVID-19 deaths, of which around 75 deaths were reported during the third wave of the pandemic.

18.title: Pant and Dhoni will stand out as India's greatest wicketkeepers: Karthik
18.article_body: Dinesh Karthik has said Rishabh Pant is on his way to greatness after the India wicketkeeper-batter  broke Kapil Dev's 40-year-old record (30-ball 50) to become the fastest half-centurion (28-ball 50) for India in Tests. He added that if Pant has a full-fledged wicketkeeping career then he and Dhoni will stand out as India's greatest wicketkeepers to have played the game.

19.title: AAP has enough experience to run Punjab govt: Bhagwant Mann
19.article_body: Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann on Monday said AAP has enough experience to run the Punjab government. "We know how to run the administration. I have been a member of [Lok Sabha] for seven years," Mann said. He added, "Many veteran politicians have lost the elections and new people have won...There'll be out of the box thinking in this government."

20.title: KTR inaugurates data sciences company Gramener's new office in Hyd
20.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday inaugurated the new office of data sciences company Gramener in Hyderabad. The New Jersey-based company's Hyderabad office will have the capacity to aid enterprises with over 250 data science resources, the Telangana government has said. "Data sciences...is hugely underrated [right now] in a country like India," KTR said at the ceremony.

21.title: India improves in Maternal Mortality Ratio, on track to achieve 2030 goal: Govt
21.article_body: India made a significant improvement in Maternal Mortality Ratio as the number of deaths per lakh childbirths declined from 113 in 2016-18 to 103 in 2017-19, said the government. The country is on track to achieve the National Health Policy (NHP) target of 100/lakh live births by 2020 and the SDG target of 70/lakh live births by 2030, it added.

22.title: BJP lied about support to displaced Kashmiri Pandit families: Kerala Cong
22.article_body: Kerala Congress said BJP lied about government support to displaced [Kashmiri] Pandit families & claimed credit for Congress government's initiatives. "UPA government gave jobs to 15,000 Pandits, recruited 6,000 Pandits in J&K government," party's tweet read. "Pandits' migration started...in January 1990. BJP did nothing and continued supporting VP Singh till November 1990," another tweet said.

23.title: Actress Rebel Wilson flashes middle finger at Putin during BAFTA Awards
23.article_body: Australian actress Rebel Wilson flashed her middle finger at Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine while hosting the BAFTA Film Awards 2022. "This is the gesture for Putin," the 42-year-old actress said, flipping her middle finger as she spoke. BAFTA's Twitter handle shared her video and tweeted, "Here's a lesson in sign language from Rebel Wilson."

24.title: Gang of robbers arrested after gunfight in Delhi's Seemapuri
24.article_body: A gang of robbers was arrested by Delhi Police on Saturday following a gunfight in Delhi's Seemapuri area. Police confiscated two stolen bicycles, one pistol, three revolvers, 37 live ammunition, pepper spray and hammers from the gang. Two of the four accused were shot after police received a tip-off and laid a trap to nab them.

25.title: Vicky wins Performance of Year, Akshay wins Person of Year at Hello Hall of Fame Awards
25.article_body: Vicky Kaushal was awarded for Performance of the Year and Akshay Kumar was named Person of the Year at the HELLO! Hall Of Fame Awards 2022. Kiara Advani won the Best Actor Critic's Choice award. Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon won for Best Actor Popular Choice male and female respectively. Veteran actress Rekha was honoured with the Cinematic Legend award.

26.title: B'luru city bus pass to be available online, can be booked via app
26.article_body: The passes for the Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) will be available online and can be booked via the mobile application Tummoc. All electronic payments, including QR codes, will be accepted for the purchase of passes. At present, passengers have to visit Traffic Transit Management Centres (TTMCs) and bus stations to obtain the passes.

27.title: Aus, Netherlands start legal action against Russia over MH17 downing
27.article_body: Australia and Netherlands said that they've started legal action against Russia at International Civil Aviation Organization over downing of Malaysian Airlines flight MH17 in July 2014. "Death of 298 civilians...can't...remain without consequences," Dutch Minister Wopke Hoekstra said. The Kuala Lumpur-bound plane was hit over rebel-held eastern Ukraine by what was deemed to be a Russian missile.

28.title: Police personnel in Madhya Pradesh to get leave to watch 'The Kashmir Files'
28.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Monday said he has informed the DGP to grant leave for one day to all police personnel in the state to watch Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', whenever they choose to do so with their families. This comes after CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday declared 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the state.

29.title: 10 humanitarian corridors to operate today: Ukraine Deputy PM
29.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk has said that the country will try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors that have been agreed upon for today. She added that civilians in towns near Kyiv and in eastern Luhansk will be able to use them. Earlier, Ukraine President said that 1.25 lakh people have been evacuated via humanitarian corridors.

30.title: Ukraine finish second behind China in 2022 Winter Paralympic medal count
30.article_body: Ukraine finished second in the 2022 Winter Paralympics in Beijing. Ukraine won 11 gold medals, 10 silver medals and eight bronze medals. China finished first with 18 gold medals and a total of 61 medals. Ukrainian athletes were the last delegation to arrive in Beijing because of logistical challenges caused by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

31.title: Rishabh Pant has backed his strengths, he's learning: Jasprit Bumrah
31.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah said the team will help Rishabh Pant go forward with the tempo he likes to play at. "You can't teach everyone to play in the same manner. Pant has backed his strengths...he's [also] learning a lot and getting experience," he added. Pant smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in the ongoing Sri Lanka Test.

32.title: India's wholesale inflation rises to 13.11% in February 2022
32.article_body: Wholesale inflation in India rose 828 basis points YoY from 4.83% in February 2021 to 13.11% in February 2022, as per Commerce Ministry's data. Wholesale inflation was at 12.96% in January 2022. The Ministry said high inflation in February was caused by rising prices of mineral oils, metals, crude petroleum, natural gas and food articles, among other commodities.

33.title: 'I'm done being quiet, grow the f*** up,' says Pete to Kanye; pics of chat surface
33.article_body: Screenshots of a text exchange between Kanye and Pete Davidson have surfaced in which Pete purportedly said, "I'm done being quiet. Grow the f*** up." Pete also said, "Kim (Kardashian) is the best mother I've ever met...You're so f****** lucky that she's your kids' mom." This came after Kanye claimed that his children weren't allowed to go to Sunday service.

34.title: 4 booked for entering B'luru stadium to take selfie with Virat Kohli
34.article_body: Four people, including two minors, have been booked for criminal trespassing after they ran onto the Bengaluru cricket stadium and tried taking a selfie with Virat Kohli on Sunday. They had trespassed into the playing area during a break at a match between India and Sri Lanka. The players continue to be in a bio bubble due to COVID-19 restrictions.

35.title: Virat said 'It's okay, you can fail': Harshal on 37-run joint-worst over in IPL history
35.article_body: Recalling his 37-run over against CSK last season, which is also the joint-worst over in IPL's history, RCB pacer Harshal Patel said, "Virat came up to me and said, 'You got hit...it happens. [When] you put yourself in difficult situations, you can [sometimes] fail'." Harshal added that Virat understands the "pressure situations" and has been very supportive of him.

36.title: Germany to buy F-35 fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear bombs: Report
36.article_body: Germany is planning to purchase F-35 fighter jets to replace its Tornado aircraft, according to a Reuters report quoting government sources. The country is reportedly looking to buy up to 35 stealth jets. Manufactured by US firm Lockheed Martin, the jets are capable of carrying nuclear bombs. Notably, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz recently announced an increase in defence spending.

37.title: Ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna sent to 14-day judicial custody in co-location scam
37.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday sent former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna to 14-day judicial custody in the co-location case. Ramkrishna, who has been accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', was arrested by the CBI a few days back. Earlier, CBI had demanded 14-day custody of Ramkrishna saying that she had been "evasive in her replies".

38.title: Will Smith, Jessica Chastain win best actor awards at Critics Choice Awards
38.article_body: Actor Will Smith won the Best Actor award and Jessica Chastain bagged the Best Actress award at the 2022 Critics Choice Awards on Sunday. While Smith won the award for the film 'King Richard', Chastain was awarded for her performance in 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The award for Best Picture went to 'The Power of the Dog'.

39.title: Won't comment, don't want to become gossip: Jubin on dating Nikita
39.article_body: Singer Jubin Nautiyal, on being asked if he is dating actress Nikita Dutta, said that he won't like to comment as they don't want to become the subject of gossip. The two sparked dating rumours after being spotted together in Mumbai's Juhu. "Nikita and I were just hanging out at a cafe in Juhu for some time," Jubin added.

40.title: Tara to star in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad's thriller 'Apurva': Reports
40.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria has signed on to star in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad Khetani's women-centric film titled 'Apurva', as per reports. The upcoming thriller is expected to be a small-budget project. 'Apurva' will reportedly be directed by Nikhil Bhat, who helmed the show 'The Gone Game'. Tara will also be seen sharing screen space with Tiger Shroff in 'Heropanti 2'.

41.title: Vanced app, which blocks YouTube ads, to shut down over 'legal reasons'
41.article_body: YouTube Vanced app, which lets users block ads on YouTube without Premium subscription, is shutting down "due to legal reasons". According to The Verge, Google had sent the Vanced owners a cease and desist letter recently. "We were asked to remove all references to 'YouTube', change the logo, and remove links related to YouTube," the Vanced team told The Verge.

42.title: Don't be afraid: Sea's secretive billionaire CEO to staff on tech firm losing $150 bn value
42.article_body: Forrest Li, the 44-year-old secretive billionaire CEO of Singapore-based technology firm Sea Ltd, which owns e-commerce platform Shopee, mobile game Garena Free Fire among other businesses, wrote a 900-word memo to his employees. The memo addressed a $150-billion plunge in his company's value since late 2021. He wrote, "This drop is painful...Do not fear: We're in a strong position internally."

43.title: I'm here for all witches: Emma seemingly criticises JK Rowling at BAFTA
43.article_body: Actress Emma Watson, who presented an award at the BAFTA Awards 2022, was introduced as a witch for her Harry Potter character Hermione Granger. Emma came to the podium and stated, "I am here for all of the witches." A social media user commented, "Sly lil dig at JK Rowling there, Emma Watson?" while another wrote, "What a QUEEEEENNN."

44.title: Kashmiri Pandits' plight an outcome of Nehruvian blunders: Union Minister
44.article_body: Days after release of 'The Kashmir Files' movie, Union Minister Jitendra Singh blamed the Congress party for the plight of Kashmiri Pandits who were forced to leave the valley. "History [is] witness to the fact that all this was a cumulative outcome of a series of Congress blunders beginning from what's now recorded as infamous Nehruvian blunders," said Singh.

45.title: Snares to catch peacocks found on hills near Pune village
45.article_body: Forest department officials are monitoring the situation after people found snares to catch peacocks on hills near a village in Pune's Hinjewadi. Hunting and killing of peacocks, which is India's National Bird, is prohibited by law and carries a sentence of up to seven years in jail, an activist said. Residents have been warned about the traps, the activist added.

46.title: Delhi fountain partially closed, PWD says 'tipplers wanted to take shower'
46.article_body: The public works department in Delhi has partially closed the fountains on the stretch along the Old BRT corridor from Chirag Dilli FOB to Sheikh Sarai corridor. "Tipplers used to come during night...take selfies, sing songs and dance along the stretch...they wanted to take a shower...or wash their faces in it...they even misbehaved with security guard," a PWD official said.

47.title: iPhone supplier Foxconn halts production in China's Shenzhen amid COVID-19 curbs
47.article_body: Apple iPhone supplier Foxconn on Monday said that it has suspended operations until further notice in China's Shenzhen city after authorities imposed lockdown measures in the tech hub city amid rising COVID-19 cases. Foxconn added it would deploy backup plants to reduce the disruption to production. On Sunday, China reported over 3,000 new daily cases, its highest in two years.

48.title: Son Junaid was rejected for Mira Nair's 'A Suitable Boy': Aamir
48.article_body: Aamir Khan has revealed that his son, Junaid Khan, went for a screen test for Mira Nair's 'A Suitable Boy' but was not selected. "He never mentioned to anyone that he was my son...He made his own journey. He learnt theatre, he did plays, he got rejected from 15-20 places," Aamir added. Junaid will make his debut with YRF's 'Maharaja'.

49.title: Class 12 Chemistry paper wasn't leaked, false propaganda being spread: Maha minister
49.article_body: Maharashtra School Education Minister Varsha Eknath Gaikwad has clarified that the Class 12 Chemistry paper of state board was not leaked. Gaikwad added that "false propaganda" is being spread through social media. This comes after reports claimed the paper was leaked hours ahead of the exam. Earlier on Monday, a coaching centre's owner was arrested in Mumbai in this connection.

50.title: SA record their highest successful chase in Women's WC history, win 3 matches in a row
50.article_body: South Africa chased down a target of 236 against defending champions England to register their highest successful chase in Women's World Cup history. South Africa's previous highest successful chase in Women's World Cup had come in 2017, when they chased down a target of 207 against Pakistan. South Africa have now won three straight matches in 2022 Women's World Cup.

51.title: COVID vaccine for 12-14 age group, booster dose for everyone above 60 from Mar 16: Govt
51.article_body: Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya today announced COVID-19 vaccination of children in age group of 12 to 14 will begin from March 16. He further said that everyone aged 60-plus will now be able to get precaution doses. He wrote, "I urge the families of children and people in the age group of 60-plus that they must get the vaccine."

52.title: Tharoor shares selfie with AAP's Mann, calls it 'parliamentary camaraderie'
52.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday posted a selfie with Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann. Sharing the picture, Tharoor wrote, "Parliamentary camaraderie...I had the pleasure of sharing his joy after five years of being seated on the same bench in the Lok Sabha in the previous term." A user commented, "This is how we want...parliamentarians across the party lines to be."

53.title: Warden of children's home in TN arrested after minor boys allege sexual abuse
53.article_body: The 36-year-old warden of a children's home in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvannamalai was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing minor boys residing at the home for past three months. Seven minor boys had reportedly called children's helpline number 1098 to report the crime. The home's owner was also arrested for neither reporting the alleged crime nor taking action against it, police said.

54.title: I gave all my time to work, forgot my family was waiting for me: Aamir Khan
54.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that he has given all his time to his work and that he thought that his family was with him anyway. "I just wanted to win the hearts of the audience at the time. And, I got completely lost, so much so that I forgot my family was waiting for me," Aamir said.

55.title: Centre allows Sikh passengers to wear kirpan on Indian flights
55.article_body: Civil Aviation Ministry has modified an earlier order restricting Sikh passengers from wearing kirpan on flights and allowed them to do so on an "Indian aircraft within India". Kirpan's total length shouldn't exceed 22.86 cm, it said. BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa shared the corrigendum's picture and thanked PM Narendra Modi and Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia for their "swift action".

56.title: Hard to digest: Pak captain Maroof on their 4th straight loss in Women's WC
56.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof expressed disappointment after they suffered their fourth straight loss in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup. "Very hard to digest. Some bad shots from the middle-order cost us the game [against Bangladesh]," she stated. Meanwhile, Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana said she can't even describe the feeling after registering their first-ever win in Women's World Cup.

57.title: AirAsia's Bengaluru-Kolkata flight makes emergency landing in Bhubaneswar, man dies
57.article_body: An AirAsia Bengaluru-Kolkata flight made an emergency landing at Biju Patnaik International Airport in Bhubaneswar after a passenger fell ill mid-flight on Sunday morning. The airport authorities dispatched an ambulance ahead of time to transport the patient to the hospital. However, the passenger could not be saved and was declared dead at the Capital Hospital.

58.title: Unattended bag inside Delhi-bound train triggers bomb scare; bomb squad called
58.article_body: A fire was reported in a train travelling to Delhi from Haryana. An unattended bag, a pouch and a container were found inside a coach. Police said the pouch containing about 2 kilograms of nails had caught fire due to friction. A bomb disposal squad reached the spot after getting information. Police claimed the bag may belong to a carpenter.

59.title: There has been improvement in Pant's method: Irfan Pathan
59.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, Irfan Pathan said there has been improvement in the 24-year-old's method. "Earlier, Pant used to play shots only on the leg side but now plays shots on the off-side as well...He now tries to find a way to stay on the pitch, doesn't only hit," added Irfan. Pant scored 185 runs in two Sri Lanka Tests.

60.title: Ukraine Prez meets injured soldiers in hospital, hands them medals
60.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday visited a military hospital in Kyiv to meet injured soldiers and handed them medals for their service to the country. A video of Zelenskyy interacting with the soldiers has been shared online. "Guys, get well soon. I believe that the best gift for your statement will be our common victory!" Zelenskyy said.

61.title: Nothing like that: Kartik on being asked if someone in B'wood is 'harassing' him
61.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, during his interaction with media at the Iconic Gold Awards 2022, was asked if someone in Bollywood was 'harassing' him. "There is nothing like that. Nobody is bothering me," he said. Kartik was reportedly fired from Dharma Productions' 'Dostana 2' last year due to 'unprofessional behaviour'. Kartik will be next seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

62.title: Pregnant Ukrainian woman whose rescue pic was shared widely dies in another Russian attack
62.article_body: A pregnant woman and her baby have died after Russia bombed the maternity hospital where she was meant to give birth. Earlier, photos of the woman being rushed to an ambulance on a stretcher were widely shared worldwide. Realising that she was losing her baby, she cried out to medics, "Kill me now!" Both she and her baby later died.

63.title: Bangladesh win a Women's World Cup match for the first time, defeat Pakistan
63.article_body: Bangladesh defeated Pakistan by nine runs to register their first-ever victory in a Women's World Cup match. Fargana Hoque top-scored as Bangladesh put up a total of 234/7. Pakistan were restricted to 225/9 despite Sidra Ameen's 104(140). Bangladesh's Fahima Khatun picked up three wickets. Pakistan have lost each of their first four 2022 Women's World Cup matches so far.

64.title: 2 boys hold poster reading 'Rohit is not my captain, reinstate Kohli', pic goes viral
64.article_body: A picture has gone viral on social media showing two boys holding a poster reading 'Rohit is not my captain, reinstate Kohli' during India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. After facing criticism from a certain section of fans, the boys' father tweeted, "Guys relax...that was for Tests only...Rohit is no doubt 'GOAT' in white-ball cricket."

65.title: Request to wear yellow turbans, shawls for swearing-in ceremony: Mann
65.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Bhagwant Mann, who will take oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab on March 16 requested public to reach Khatkar Kalan for the ceremony. "I request my brothers to wear yellow turbans that day and sisters to drape yellow shawls/stoles. We will colour Khatkar Kalan in 'Basanti rang' that day," he added.

66.title: 7 killed in fire at chemical plant in China
66.article_body: As many as seven people were reportedly killed after a fire broke out at a chemical plant in China on Monday. The accident occurred during some maintenance activity at Bao Gang United Steel plant in the country's Inner Mongolia region. After reaching the site, the rescue team found that seven people were missing, all of whom were later found dead.

67.title: 'Pushpa' actress Rashmika in talks for a song in Ranbir's 'Animal': Reports
67.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, who was recently seen in 'Pushpa: The Rise', is reportedly in talks for a special song in 'Animal', an upcoming action film starring Ranbir Kapoor. It will be directed by 'Kabir Singh' fame director Sandeep Reddy Vanga and will also feature Parineeti Chopra, Bobby Deol and Anil Kapoor. 'Animal' is expected to release on August 11, 2023.

68.title: At least 596 civilians killed since Russia attacked Ukraine
68.article_body: The Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights said that at least 596 civilians including 43 children have been killed in Ukraine since Russia's attack. The number of those injured stood at 1,067 including 57 children, it added. Most of the casualties were caused by the use of explosive weapons including shelling, missiles and airstrikes, it said.

69.title: I still own & won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge: Elon Musk
69.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I still own and won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge." However, he added, "As a general principle...It's generally better...to own physical things like a home or stock in companies you think make good products...than dollars when inflation is high." Bitcoin, Ether and Doge prices saw a brief spike after Musk's tweet.

70.title: Had Emirati wedding with Rubina in Abu Dhabi: Abhinav Shukla on 'Wanderlust'
70.article_body: Actor Abhinav Shukla, while talking about series 'Wanderlust' said that he had an Emirati wedding with his wife and actress Rubina Dilaik in Abu Dhabi. "We were dressed like the local...groom and the bride. And we were, we are a very close experience of how it would be locationally...getting married...in that style...that was memorable," Abhinav added.

71.title: ITBP official martyred, head constable injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh
71.article_body: An official of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) was martyred and a head constable suffered injuries when a pressure improvised explosive device (IED) planted by Naxals exploded in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur on Monday, police said. The incident took place when a team of ITBP's 53rd battalion was out on patrolling duty to ensure security to a road construction work, police added.

72.title: PM Modi is a man of tremendous vigour and dynamism: Shashi Tharoor
72.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said PM Narendra Modi is a man of "tremendous vigour and dynamism". "The PM has done some things which are very impressive, especially politically. We didn't expect him to win with such great margins, but he did," he said. "The Indian voter has the capacity to surprise...but right now they've given BJP what they wanted," Tharoor added.

73.title: I love Jadeja's game among the new cricketers: Kapil Dev
73.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev has said he loves all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's game among the new cricketers. "Jadeja plays without pressure. He enjoys cricket. That's why he's good at bowling as well as batting. He also does a great job in fielding," stated Kapil. Jadeja smashed unbeaten 175 and picked a total of nine wickets in first Test against Sri Lanka.

74.title: 35-yr-old man charred to death after car catches fire in Bengaluru
74.article_body: A 35-year-old man was charred to death after his car accidentally caught fire on Bengaluru's NICE Road, police said. According to police, the man had pulled his car to a side and was trying to get out after he noticed the fire in the AC vent. A passerby had rushed to help the deceased when the car exploded, police added.

75.title: Taiwan's fighter jet crashes into sea; second incident in 3 months
75.article_body: A Taiwanese fighter jet crashed into the sea off its southeast coast, said the presidential office on Monday. The French-built Mirage 2000 aircraft was on a training mission from the Chihhang air base in Taitung. The pilot was reported to be safe after parachuting out of the crashing plane. In January, an F-16 jet crashed, killing the pilot.

76.title: A top industrialist asked me to sleep with his wife at my nightclub: Tehseen Poonawalla
76.article_body: Venture Capitalist and political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla, revealed in the reality show 'Lock Upp', that a top industrialist once asked him to sleep with his wife. "He booked my entire nightclub for [weekend]. His condition was that he wanted to see me sleeping with his wife." Tehseen further said that he did it as the industrialist watched.

77.title: Delhi Police personnel save 20-year-old law student who jumped into Yamuna river
77.article_body: Three Delhi Police personnel jumped into Yamuna river to save a 20-year-old law student who tried to kill himself after failing in one of his exams. The student belongs to Rajasthan's Alwar and studies at National Law School of India University, Bengaluru. Officials said Alwar police informed that a man will try to kill himself as he tweeted about it.

78.title: 15 arrested after several men sexually assault women in MP as onlookers recorded videos
78.article_body: As many as 15 people, including the prime accused, have been arrested after several men sexually assaulted two women on a street during the Bhagoria festival in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur. A video had surfaced online showing the men molesting the women one by one as onlookers recorded videos on their phones.

79.title: Maha board's Class 12 Chemistry paper leaked; coaching centre owner arrested
79.article_body: The Class 12 chemistry paper of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education has allegedly been leaked in Mumbai. Police in Vile Parle have arrested a teacher, who is the owner of a coaching centre in Malad, in connection with the paper leak. The accused allegedly shared the paper on a WhatsApp group before the exam, police said.

80.title: 6.7-magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia's Sumatra; no casualties reported
80.article_body: An earthquake of 6.7 magnitude struck Indonesia's Sumatra island on Monday prompting residents to flee homes. The epicentre was located at about 167 km from the coastal city of Pariaman, as per US Geological Survey. No loss of life or other damages were reported. The authorities initially warned of a potential tsunami but later lifted the warning.

81.title: Bees attack 200 tourists at Pune's Shivneri Fort, 25 hospitalised
81.article_body: At least 200 tourists were stung by bees at Shivneri Fort in Pune on Sunday. State forest department officials said that at least 25 tourists were hospitalised and discharged after primary treatment at a local government hospital. "Swarms of bees from at least three beehives located near the main entrance of the fort were galvanised," an official said.

82.title: Paytm shares fall to all-time low of ₹672 after RBI curbs on Paytm Payments Bank
82.article_body: The shares of Paytm fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE in Monday's early deals. This comes after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers until its audit is done. The stock has declined around 70% compared to its issue price of ₹2,150 per share.

83.title: It's not just attack, attack, there's a lot of method to it: Jaffer on Pant's batting
83.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said there's a lot of method to Rishabh Pant's attacking batting. "Pant comes out and attacks...he puts the (opposition) team on the back foot, and then he plays the waiting game and then surprises with his attacking shots," Jaffer explained. Pant smashed the fastest fifty by an Indian in Tests while playing against Sri Lanka.

84.title: I've absolutely no regrets: Asha Parekh on not getting married
84.article_body: Veteran actress Asha Parekh has featured on the cover of Harper's Bazaar India for its 13th-anniversary issue. The 79-year-old actress opened up about not getting married and said, "I guess I wasn't destined to get married." "Honestly, I'd have loved to get married and have children...but it wasn't meant to be...However, I've absolutely no regrets," Asha told Harper's Bazaar India.

85.title: Obama tests COVID-19 +ve, PM Modi wishes him a quick recovery
85.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama on Sunday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus, while his wife Michelle has tested negative. Following this, PM Narendra Modi extended his wishes for Obama's quick recovery and for his family's good health and wellbeing. Obama added that both he and his wife are "grateful to be vaccinated and boosted" against the virus.

86.title: 4 devotees killed, 16 hurt after truck hits tractor-trolley in Maha
86.article_body: Four people were killed and 16 others were injured after a truck hit a tractor-trolley carrying devotees on Solapur-Pune highway near Maharashtra's Kondi village, police said on Monday. The truck's driver lost control after a tyre burst, following which the incident had occurred, a police official said. The devotees were travelling to Pandharpur to celebrate 'Ekadashi', a police official added.

87.title: CPI MP gives notice to discuss slashing of interest rates on EPF
87.article_body: The Communist Party of India (CPI) Rajya Sabha MP Binoy Viswam gave a suspension of business notice under rule 267 to discuss the decision of slashing of interest rates on EPF (Employees' Provident Fund) in Rajya Sabha. "The decision of EPFO to slash interest rates will result in significant monetary losses to 60 million salaried class subscribers," the notice read.

88.title: Man handcuffs himself to door of McDonald's outlet in Russia, pic surfaces
88.article_body: A man identified as pianist Luca Zatravkin handcuffed himself to the entrance door of a McDonald's outlet in Russia after McDonald's announced it is temporarily shutting down all its restaurants in Russia amid war with Ukraine. "They don't need to shut it down. What's their reason for shutting down?" he said. He was later arrested by the police.

89.title: Treat people well at police station, offer senior citizens water: Mumbai CP
89.article_body: Sanjay Pandey, Commissioner of Police, Mumbai, told Mumbai Police personnel to treat people well at the police stations. "If we don't behave with people properly and use berating language, it will tarnish our image. If any senior citizen comes to our police station, we should offer him a glass of water," he said, adding, "Every complainant should be treated equally."

90.title: IMD issues heatwave alert in Mumbai, Thane, Raigad for next 2 days
90.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert with a warning of a heatwave in Thane, Mumbai, Raigad and north Konkan for the next two days. While the maximum temperature in Mumbai is likely to rise to 39 degrees Celsius, the minimum temperature is forecasted to rise to 24 degrees Celsius. Mumbai recorded 38.6 degrees Celsius on Sunday.

91.title: Didn't join politics to check prices of aloo, tamatar: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
91.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said he didn't join politics to check the prices of 'aloo, tamatar', as he attacked the Opposition for tabling a no-confidence motion against him. The 69-year-old cricketer-turned-politician said that 25 years ago, he decided to join politics for the sake of the country's youth, adding that he had no personal gains from doing so.

92.title: 2 found dead in Worli, suicide suspected: Mumbai Police
92.article_body: The Mumbai Police said it has recovered two bodies, both suspected to have died by suicide in Worli on Sunday. According to the officials, one was found hanging from a tree while the other was found near Worli Sea Face. The bodies have been sent to the Nair Hospital for post-mortem, police said.

93.title: Gr Noida’s Kisan Chowk to get underpass, work to begin in 5-6 months: GNIDA
93.article_body: In order to tackle traffic congestion, the Greater Noida authority will finalise a tender to construct an underpass at Kisan Chowk in the next three months, said an official. The authority said the work is expected to begin in the next five to six months and the underpass will be ready in two years after that.

94.title: Arsenal move into top four, Chelsea defeat Newcastle in Premier League
94.article_body: Arsenal moved into Premier League's top four with a 2-0 win over Leicester City on Sunday night. Arsenal, with 51 points, have three games in hand on Manchester United, who are now placed fifth with 50 points. Meanwhile, Chelsea remain on third after their 1-0 win against Newcastle United. Manchester City are at the top with 69 points.

95.title: Russia asked for military equipment from China for its war in Ukraine: Report
95.article_body: Russia has asked China for military assistance including drones amid its ongoing war in Ukraine, a top US official cited by CNN broadcaster said. However, Liu Pengyu, the Chinese embassy spokesperson in Washington, said he was unaware of any suggestions that China might be willing to help Russia. Meanwhile, US warned China there would be consequences if it helped Russia.

96.title: 2 newly-elected councillors belonging to TMC, Cong shot dead in West Bengal
96.article_body: Two newly-elected councillors, one belonging to TMC and another to Congress, were shot dead by unidentified miscreants in separate incidents in West Bengal. While TMC blamed BJP for councillor Anupam Dutta's killing in Panihati, Congress has held TMC responsible for Congress councillor Tapan Kandu's murder in Jhalda. "Law and order [situation] is crumbling in Bengal," BJP's Suvendu Adhikari said.

97.title: Kangana once met astrologer, he said she's going to be a heroine: Prabhas
97.article_body: Actor Prabhas, during an interview about his new film 'Radhe Shyam', said that actress Kangana Ranaut had once met an astrologer who told her she's going to be a heroine. Prabhas added that Kangana felt that the astrologer was fooling her and she did not pay much attention to his prediction. Prabhas can be seen playing palmist in 'Radhe Shyam'.

98.title: BSF deputy commandant dies after fall during training in WB
98.article_body: A BSF deputy commandant died on Sunday during a physical training programme in West Bengal's Baishnabnagar, a BSF statement said. According to the statement, Ajit Singh Tanwar had complained of chest pain after he lost his balance and fell on the ground. Tanwar, who's aged 55, was taken to a hospital where he was declared brought dead, the statement added.

99.title: Man saved from falling into gap between platform, train in Mumbai's Wadala
99.article_body: An RPF constable saved a man from falling into gap between the platform and the train at Wadala station in Mumbai on Sunday. "Timely act of RPF constable Netrapal Singh, saved the life of a passenger who slipped and fell down while boarding running local train at Wadala station...Passengers are requested not to board/de-board a moving train," Central Railway tweeted.

100.title: Feels good: Jasprit Bumrah on 1st five-wicket haul on Indian soil
100.article_body: Talking about his first five-wicket haul in his fourth Test match on Indian soil, Jasprit Bumrah said it feels good to have contributed towards the team's success in the ongoing second Test against Sri Lanka. "When you play all three formats, you have to look after your body and you sometimes miss out on the home Tests," he added.

101.title: Who won what at BAFTA Film Awards 2022?
101.article_body: Jane Campion-directorial 'The Power of the Dog' was named the Best Film at BAFTA Awards 2022. Will Smith won the Best Actor award for 'King Richard' and Joanna Scanlan won the Best Actress award for 'After Love'. Ariana DeBose was named Best Supporting Actress, while Troy Kotsur won the Best Supporting Actor award. 'Dune' also clinched Best Cinematography award.

102.title: Delhi govt seeks monkey experts to check menace at Vidhan Sabha
102.article_body: In a bid to control the disturbance caused by monkeys at the Vidhan Sabha complex, the Delhi government has floated a tender seeking experts in primate psychology. "Some officials nearly got bitten… monkeys snatch food, files from employees… they jump on cars parked in the complex and damage them," said an official working at the Vidhan Sabha.

103.title: 'Avengers: Endgame', 'Body Heat' actor William Hurt passes away at 71
103.article_body: Actor William Hurt, who played Thaddeus Ross in 'Avengers: Endgame' and 'Captain America: Civil War', has passed away at the age of 71. The Academy Award-winning actor died on March 13, one week before his 72nd birthday, of natural causes, his son Will said. William was also known for his roles in 'Body Heat' and 'Kiss of the Spider Woman'.

104.title: Woman, 3-yr-old son die as motorcycle falls into canal in Haryana
104.article_body: A 27-year-old woman, Manju, and her three-year-old son, Yatin, drowned to death after motorcycle they were riding fell into canal in Haryana's Fatehabad. The woman's husband sustained injuries in the incident. Spokesperson of Fatehabad police said that passersby rescued the woman's husband. The motorcycle was also fished out from the canal. Efforts are being made to retrieve bodies of deceased.

105.title: There was no one: Aamir Khan on rumours he divorced Kiran as he was dating someone
105.article_body: Aamir Khan refuted rumours that he and Kiran Rao got divorced as he was dating someone. "Our relationship of husband and wife experienced a certain change and we wanted to respect...institution of marriage," he said. Aamir also clarified he didn’t divorce his first wife Reena Dutta because of Kiran, saying he and Kiran became friends after his divorce with Reena.

106.title: In a first, BJD forms Zilla Parishads in all 30 districts of Odisha
106.article_body: The ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) has become the first party to form Zilla Parishads in all 30 districts of Odisha. "This is an unprecedented victory for BJD and the result of the faith of the voters in the leadership of CM Naveen Patnaik," party leader Pinaki Misra said. He added that 70% of the Zilla Parishad Presidents are women.

107.title: Zelenskyy urges NATO for no-fly zone after Russian attack near Polish border kills 35
107.article_body: A day after 35 people were killed in a Russian missile attack on a military base near Polish border in Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged NATO to impose a no-fly zone in a video statement. "If you don't close our sky, it is only a matter of time before Russian rockets fall on your territory, on NATO territory," he said.

108.title: India reports 2,503 new COVID-19 cases, 27 deaths in 24 hours
108.article_body: India has reported 2,503 new COVID-19 cases and 27 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 3,116 cases and 47 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 36,168, while the death toll in the country reached 5,15,877.

109.title: 50-yr-old shrine vandalised, painted saffron in Madhya Pradesh; FIR lodged
109.article_body: A 50-year-old shrine located near Hoshangabad on Madhya Pradesh State Highway 22 was allegedly vandalised and painted saffron by unidentified miscreants. The shrine's caretaker alleged the wooden doors of the shrine were broken open and a hand pump inside the compound was uprooted. "We've registered an FIR, but our priority is to restore the shrine first," a police officer said.

110.title: 50 new bus routes started in Pune amid MSRTC workers' strike: Report
110.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has started over 50 routes across and outside the district in the last two months amid the ongoing Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) workers' strike, reported Hindustan Times. A PMPML traffic manager said that the new routes have been started following demands from people in rural areas and local representatives.

111.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 4 people, recover 1.2 kg ganja from them
111.article_body: Hyderabad Police have arrested four people and have seized 1.2 kg ganja from them. Police, while sharing details of case, said that Bowenpally Police had found circumstances of seven people suspicious. Police said that the seven people tried to run away from the spot but the police chased and caught two people. Three cellphones and three bikes have been recovered.

112.title: Lady Gaga, Selena Gomez walk red carpet at Critics Choice Awards
112.article_body: Several celebrities, including Lady Gaga and Selena Gomez, walked the red carpet at the 27th annual Critics Choice Awards 2022. Gaga opted for a black-and-gold Gucci ensemble, styled by Tom Erebout and Sandra Amador. Meanwhile, Selena wore a Louis Vuitton gown at the ceremony, where she was nominated for Best Actress in Comedy Series for 'Only Murders in the Building'.

113.title: Messi, Neymar booed by own fans in 1st match after Champions League exit
113.article_body: After PSG's 2-3 aggregate loss to Real Madrid in Champions League, Neymar and Lionel Messi were booed by their own fans throughout their Ligue 1 game against Bordeaux. "I feel sad about what I saw," said coach Mauricio Pochettino. Kylian Mbappe, who was the only scorer for PSG in their Champions League tie against Madrid, was applauded in the match.

114.title: Man seeking ₹3 lakh loan cheated of ₹6.3 lakh in Pune
114.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Pune who was promised a personal loan of ₹3 lakh was allegedly cheated of ₹6.3 lakh by callers. The victim was asked to pay money in smaller amounts over nine months on the pretext of processing fees, an insurance and advance EMIs, said police, adding he was also promised an increase in loan amount.

115.title: 3 Delhi Police personnel assault traffic inspector after being asked to move car; held
115.article_body: Three Delhi Police personnel have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a traffic police inspector in Delhi's Hauz Khas area. According to police, the inspector had asked the accused to move their car as it was parked on the wrong side of the road, but the latter got angry and allegedly attacked him. Victim claimed one of the policemen slapped him.

116.title: Rickshaw driver arrested for running over pedestrian in Pune
116.article_body: A 29-year-old rickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly running over a pedestrian, a 21-year-old businessman, in Pune. According to police, the victim ignored some questions from the rickshaw driver after which the latter got enraged and ran the vehicle over him. The victim reportedly sustained a fractured hand and backbone among other injuries.

117.title: Pune MBA student cheated of ₹1L over 'work from home' job, 3 booked
117.article_body: At least three people were booked following a cheating case in which a 23-year-old MBA student in Maharashtra's Pune was defrauded of ₹1.38 lakh last year on pretext of a 'work from home' job. Police said the victim found the job on social media and was initially paid for some assignments before being asked to pay for a bigger assignment.

118.title: 2 fans take selfie with Virat Kohli after invading ground, pics go viral
118.article_body: Two fans breached security and invaded the ground while Sri Lanka's Kusal Mendis was taking treatment after being hit by a Mohammad Shami delivery in the sixth over of their second innings. The fans took a selfie with Virat Kohli before being escorted out by security personnel. The match is being held at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

119.title: Fan invades ground before being chased by around 10 officials during India-SL Test
119.article_body: A fan invaded the ground during India-Sri Lanka Test at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru during a break forced by a medical issue to Kusal Mendis. The fan was seen running towards Virat Kohli as around 10 security officials chased him. He ran towards the other side of the ground before eventually being caught.

120.title: Mumbai targets net-zero carbon emissions by 2050; 2 decades ahead of India's target
120.article_body: Mumbai has announced a Climate Action Plan to eliminate carbon emissions by 2050. Mumbai has proposed exhaustive changes to the way it manages energy, water, air, waste, green spaces and transport for its 19 million residents. Mumbai's target puts it two decades ahead of India's national goal, as the country has promised to cut its emissions to net-zero by 2070.

121.title: Confident of BJP's win in MP Assembly elections 2023: Scindia
121.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has claimed that "BJP will win" in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly elections next year. He said, "MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan is working day and night for the people's welfare and I am sure BJP will win." When asked about the Congress, Scindia said, "Congress was my past and don't want to waste time on it."

122.title: 5 Indian students aged between 21 and 24 killed in road accident in Canada
122.article_body: Five Indian students aged between 21 and 24 were killed, while two others were hospitalised after a road accident near Toronto, India's High Commissioner to Canada Ajay Bisaria said. The passenger van in which the students were travelling collided with a tractor trailer. The deceased students were identified as Harpreet Singh, Jaspinder Singh, Karanpal Singh, Mohit Chouhan and Pawan Kumar.

123.title: Woman thanks Bengaluru police for helping her escape barking dogs on road
123.article_body: A woman named Seema Khan took to Twitter to share an incident when a female inspector helped her escape "barking dogs" while Khan was returning to her hostel late at night in Bengaluru's Banaswadi. "Inspector Sheela took me to my hostel safely...I really want to share this...for girls who need any help," Khan wrote. "Very thankful," Khan captioned her post.

124.title: MoS Chandrasekhar reviews Gallium Nitride tech centre in Bengaluru
124.article_body: A press release said on Sunday that Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar has visited Gallium Nitride Ecosystem Enabling Centre and Incubator facility at IISc Bengaluru. "The next two-three years [offer] a window of opportunity for Gallium Nitride to play a key role in enabling e-vehicles and wireless communication," he said after reviewing the work there.

125.title: Someone asked me 'Is Jalsa a biopic on Amitabh Bachchan's house': Vidya
125.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan said that someone asked her if her upcoming movie 'Jalsa' was a biopic on actor Amitabh Bachchan's house which goes by the same name. "I said 'you will have to wait for the answer to this question'," Vidya said, adding, "Because what do you say, how can it be the biopic of a house?"

126.title: Mumbai 1st South Asian city to announce net-zero emission roadmap
126.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday announced detailed plans to make Mumbai a net-zero carbon emitter by 2050, making it the first South Asian city to do so. Putting Mumbai two decades ahead of India's national goal, the plan proposes large-scale changes in six domains. Flood-resistant drainage and investment in housing and sanitation are some of the proposed changes.

127.title: Amazon moves staff from Seattle office amid rise in violent crimes
127.article_body: Amazon is temporarily relocating employees from a downtown Seattle office amid an increase in violent crime in the area. There have been at least three shootings, two stabbings and one carjacking in the area since February 21, according to the Seattle Police Department's Twitter account. Amazon said it is providing employees currently at that location with alternative office space elsewhere.

128.title: Police recover 6 kg 'charas' worth ₹1.95 cr from peddler in Mumbai
128.article_body: Police on Sunday arrested a drug peddler from Mumbai's Dahisar area and recovered over 6 kg of 'charas' worth ₹1.95 crore in the international market. "Yesterday, we received information that a person is arriving with some narcotics substance...A court has remanded him to police custody till March 17," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Zone 12 Mumbai) Somnath Gharge.

129.title: Govt must enrol us in colleges here: HP student back from Ukraine
129.article_body: A student from Himachal Pradesh, who returned to India from Ukraine, has sought the Central Government's intervention in helping the students complete their medical degrees in the country. Kashika Mahajan, who was a fourth-year student in Ukraine, said that students hope that the government makes special arrangements to enrol the students in medical colleges in India.

130.title: Minor among 8 booked for performing wheelies in K'taka, bikes seized
130.article_body: Eight people, including a minor, were booked for allegedly performing motorbike stunts on the streets of Karnataka's Mangaluru and the police also seized five two-wheelers. Police received multiple complaints from locals informing that the youths were performing stunts and four different cases were registered. Police found vehicles' registration numbers after monitoring social media.

131.title: Yogi will take UP to greater heights of development: PM Modi
131.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday met Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and said that he "will take the state to greater heights of development". In a tweet, PM Modi wrote, "Congratulating him (Yogi Adityanath) on the historic victory in the Uttar Pradesh elections. In the last five years, he has worked tirelessly to fulfil the aspirations of the people."

132.title: 4 arrested for looting petrol pumps in Meghalaya; gun, machete seized
132.article_body: The Meghalaya Police have arrested four people for their alleged involvement in looting petrol pumps across the state, an officer said. Police on Friday raided a hideout of the accused and recovered an AK-47 rifle, 14 live rounds of ammunition, a machete and a motorcycle, Superintendent of Police of East Jaintia Hills, Jagpal Singh Dhanoa said on Saturday.

133.title: Newborn baby stolen from govt hospital in Tamil Nadu, 2 detained
133.article_body: A man and a woman in their 30s have been detained for allegedly stealing a newborn baby from a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Kancheepuram district. The baby's mother had reportedly gone to the washroom leaving the baby in another patient's care and found the child missing after returning. The accused pair were later caught at a bus stop.

134.title: Int'l Yoga Day to be held at 75 heritage, cultural sites this year
134.article_body: Union Ayush Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on Sunday inaugurated the Yoga Mahotsav 2022 to mark 100 days countdown to the 8th International Day of Yoga. The event will be held at 75 iconic heritage and cultural sites on International Yoga Day on June 21. "It's an opportunity to promote health, wellbeing and peace across the globe," Sonowal said in his address.

135.title: ₹2 cr to be spent on Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in as Punjab CM: Cong
135.article_body: Congress' official media platform on Sunday claimed that ₹2 crore will be spent on Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in as Punjab Chief Minister. "Bhagwant Mann is eager to empty the treasury of Punjab as soon as he arrives," the post said. Congress MLA Sukhpal Singh Khaira called it a "gross misuse of public exchequer" and said that it was "unacceptable."

136.title: 2.5 kg heroin recovered by STF in Punjab's Ludhiana, 4 arrested
136.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) Punjab on Sunday arrested four drug peddlers in Ludhiana and recovered 2.5 kilograms of heroin. Ludhiana STF in charge, Inspector Harbans Singh said that they caught the accused while they were travelling in a car near Golden Avenue on Dhandra road following a tip-off. "The accused hold a long criminal record", he added.

137.title: It'll be challenging for SL on Day 3 of Day-Night Test vs India: Vihari
137.article_body: India batter Hanuma Vihari said it'll be difficult for Sri Lanka on Day 3 of the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru after being 28/1 at stumps on Day 2, needing 419 more runs to win. "It was quite challenging [today]. A kind of wicket where any ball could get you out," he added. India declared their second innings at 303/9.

138.title: World no. 12 Lakshya loses to world no. 20 Vitidsarn in German Open final
138.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen lost to world number 20 Kunlavut Vitidsarn in the final at German Open in Mülheim an der Ruhr on Sunday. The 20-year-old Indian shuttler was beaten 21-18, 21-15 by the Thai player in 57 minutes. World number 12 Lakshya had defeated world number one and Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen in the semi-finals on Saturday.

139.title: Scindia inaugurates FlyBig Airlines' Indore-Gondia-Hyderabad flight
139.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia inaugurated FlyBig airlines' Indore-Gondia-Hyderabad flight route virtually at an event on Sunday. The services will be run under UDAN Regional Connectivity Scheme. "Indore needs to be connected with other smaller cities," Scindia said, adding, there are plans for smaller planes and helicopters to connect cities across the country "till the last mile".

140.title: Kazakhstan's Anti-Corruption Agency detains former President's nephew
140.article_body: Kazakhstan's Anti-Corruption Agency on Sunday detained former President Nursultan Nazarbayev's nephew, Kairat Satybaldy in connection to an embezzlement probe at communications firm Kazakhtelecom. Nazarbayev and many of his relatives were removed from top posts by his successor and current President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev after protests over fuel prices turned violent killing 225 people in January.

141.title: No foreign military personnel present in Maldives: Defence Ministry
141.article_body: The Maldivian Defence Ministry said on Saturday that there's no armed foreign military personnel present in the country. No foreign parties would be active at the Uthuru Thilafalhu (UTF) base, where the Maldives National Defence Force (MNDF)’s Coast Guard dock and dockyard are being developed, reports stated. This comes amid the Maldivian Opposition's 'India Out' campaign.

142.title: World beater: Jaffer on Pant scoring fastest 50 for India in Tests
142.article_body: Calling Rishabh Pant a "world beater" after he scored fastest Test fifty by an Indian against Sri Lanka in Day-Night Test, Wasim Jaffer said the frequency with which India wicketkeeper-batter produces such knocks is incredible. "Usually if a batter is mercurial he's not consistent. But in Pant we've a mercurial batter who's consistent," he added. Pant scored a 28 ball-50.

143.title: We should take lead in 6G technology: Ashwini Vaishnaw
143.article_body: Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday said, "[India] should take the lead in 6G technology. Otherwise, what's the point of being a nation which is...called a talent nation." "We have already initiated work on 6G also, as we have made very good progress on 4G and 5G," he added. India's 5G spectrum auction may take place in May, PTI reported.

144.title: MP man dies, wife injured after being attacked by drug addict son
144.article_body: A 50-year-old man died and his wife sustained severe injuries after being attacked by their drug addict son in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. The accused, Neeraj Kushwaha, was reportedly demanding money for drugs from his father for the last three days but was refused. On Sunday, he came home in an inebriated state and beat his parents with a stick.

145.title: Crashed drone that apparently flew from Ukraine carried a bomb: Croatia
145.article_body: A military drone that apparently flew from Ukraine and crashed in the Croatian capital, Zagreb, was carrying a bomb, Croatia's Defence Minister Mario Banožić said on Sunday. This further raises a question about whether the drone belonged to Russia or Ukraine, he added. The Soviet-era drone had flown over Romania and Hungary, both NATO-member states, before entering Croatia.

146.title: 'Bachchhan Paandey' is a fun film: Jacqueline Fernandez
146.article_body: Talking about 'Bachchhan Paandey', actress Jacqueline Fernandez said, "It's a fun film...I'm there for a cute little appearance." Jacqueline further said that she worked with actors Arshad Warsi and Kriti Sanon for the first time and added, "It was a nice experience." "With Kriti, I just had one day, but that was really a memorable one," she stated.

147.title: Actor Pulkit Samrat shares pictures from the set of 'Fukrey 3'
147.article_body: Actor Pulkit Samrat took to Instagram and shared pictures from the set of his upcoming film 'Fukrey 3'. "Fukrey 3 apki seva mein (Fukrey 3 at your service)," Pulkit captioned the post. The film is the third installation of the 2013 film 'Fukrey'. Actor Ali Fazal will reportedly not be part of 'Fukrey 3' due to scheduling issues.

148.title: China shuts tech hub over 66 COVID-19 cases, puts 17 mn people in lockdown
148.article_body: China on Sunday locked down one of its biggest cities with 17 million residents after 66 new COVID-19 infections were reported there. The southern Chinese tech hub of Shenzhen has told all its residents to stay at home to control an Omicron outbreak linked to Hong Kong. China's national cases reached a two-year high of nearly 3,400 on Sunday.

149.title: Ukrainian man learns his wife, 2 kids died after seeing their dead bodies on Twitter
149.article_body: A Ukrainian man named Serhiy Perebyinis learned about the death of his wife, and two kids, aged 18 and 9, after seeing the photos of their dead bodies on Twitter. They were killed by mortar fire last Sunday as they attempted to flee via a damaged bridge in Irpin. "I recognized their luggage," Perebyinis told The New York Times.

150.title: Russian court allows Peppa Pig piracy without punishment after Western sanctions
150.article_body: A Russian court has ruled that Peppa Pig's trademarks can be used by Russian businesses without punishment. Entertainment One, which owns the rights of the cartoon character had asked for 40,000 roubles in compensation from a Russian entrepreneur who had drawn his own version of the character. The court dismissed the case citing "unfriendly actions of US and affiliated countries."

151.title: Former Hyderabad captain Ravi Teja retires from first-class cricket
151.article_body: Former Hyderabad skipper Ravi Teja has retired from first-class cricket. The 34-year-old batter thanked his well-wishers for their constant support. Teja made his first-class debut in 2006. He represented Hyderabad and Meghalaya in domestic cricket. In his 16-year-long domestic career, Teja also represented India U-19, India A and the now-defunct IPL franchise Deccan Chargers.

152.title: Turkey & Greece leaders hold talks in rare meeting, discuss Ukraine
152.article_body: Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan held talks in Istanbul on Sunday in a rare meeting between the two countries that have been at odds over several issues. They discussed bilateral issues, as well as the Russian invasion of Ukraine, according to a statement. "Turkey and Greece have...special responsibility in the European security architecture," it added.

153.title: Malaysia reports 26,250 COVID-19 cases, 77 deaths in a day
153.article_body: Malaysian Health Ministry reported 26,250 new COVID-19 cases as of Saturday midnight taking the total caseload to over 38 lakh since the pandemic began. As per data released by the ministry, 77 deaths were recorded in the same period bringing the total death toll to 33,720. Meanwhile, out of 26,250 cases, 545 were reported to be imported cases.

154.title: Nadal beats 21-yr-old Korda in 3 sets, says 'Lucky to be through'
154.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated world number 38 Sebastian Korda 6-2, 1-6, 7-6(7-3) in the second round at Indian Wells. After winning the match by recovering from 2-5 down in the third set, Nadal said, "I feel very lucky today to be through. Sebastian was playing some fantastic tennis." Notably, Nadal is now undefeated in all 16 matches he played this year.

155.title: Sonia Gandhi will immediately take steps to revamp party: Congress
155.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi will immediately take up corrective measures to revamp and re-strengthen the party, AICC general secretary KC Venugopal said after Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday. Congress will hold a 'Chintan Shivir' immediately after the Budget Session of Parliament, he said, adding that the CWC will meet before that. Former PM Manmohan Singh didn't attend the meeting.

156.title: Being social media influencer helped break child actor tag: Anushka
156.article_body: Anushka Sen has said that being a social media influencer has helped her break the tag of being a child actor. "Thanks to social media that people got to know the real me, the real Anushka...I don't think people just see me as a child actor," she stated. "I didn't realise when...transition happened because I was always working," she added.

157.title: Family growing: AAP as 16 Amritsar municipal councillors join party
157.article_body: Sixteen councillors of the Amritsar Municipal Corporation have joined AAP, the party tweeted from its official account on Sunday. "AAP family is growing...After winning Assembly, AAP's flag is now waving in municipal corporations too!" the tweet read. The councillors joined in the presence of party leader Manish Sisodia, AAP's Punjab in-charge Jarnail Singh and city Mayor Karamjit Singh Rintu.

158.title: 5 people rape 22-yr-old, record the act to blackmail her in Raj
158.article_body: A 22-year-old was allegedly gang-raped by five people in Rajasthan's Ajmer, who also recorded the act to blackmail her, police said on Sunday. A case was registered at Nasirabad Sadar Police Station and Circle Officer Poonam Bhargad said the woman, a resident of Nizampura, named three of the five accused in her complaint, which was lodged on Thursday.

159.title: China to face consequences if it helps Russia evade sanctions: US
159.article_body: Speaking to CNN, US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said that China would face consequences if it helped Russia evade sweeping sanctions over the war in Ukraine. "We'll not allow...there to be a lifeline to Russia from these economic sanctions from any country," he added. Sullivan's remarks come ahead of his meeting with China's top diplomat Yang Jiechi on Monday.

160.title: 1.25 lakh evacuated via humanitarian corridors in Ukraine: Prez
160.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that nearly 1.25 lakh people have been evacuated via humanitarian corridors from conflict zones in Ukraine so far. He described providing relief to besieged Mariupol as a "key task", with a humanitarian supply convoy 80 kilometres away from the city. Supplies in Mariupol are running low amid a Russian blockade, local officials said.

161.title: K'taka lost ₹221 cr to cybercrimes in last 3 years: State Home Minister
161.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Sunday said the state has lost ₹221.17 crore to cybercrimes in the last three years and only 21% of the amount has been recovered. Karnataka reported at least 32,286 cases between 2019-2022 and only 7,835 such cases have been solved. In the same period, only 75 persons have been convicted for cybercrime, Jnanendra added.

162.title: Cong lost in U'khand despite conducive environment: Ex-CM Rawat
162.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat on Sunday while taking responsibility for Congress' Assembly election defeat in the state "despite conducive environment", said the party needs to look into the reasons behind the "constant defeats". He added, "We'll work on suggestions for improvement that'll come in CWC." Congress won 19 seats in the 70-member state Assembly while BJP won 47 seats.

163.title: UK to criminalise sending unsolicited sexual pics on social media
163.article_body: The UK government has said that a law criminalising 'cyberflashing' or sending unsolicited sexual images to people through social media or dating apps, will be included in its Online Safety Bill. "Anyone who sends a photo or film of a person's genitals, for the purpose of their own sexual gratification...may face up to two years in prison," the government explained.

164.title: Every worker wants Rahul Gandhi to lead the party: Congress
164.article_body: After the Congress Working Committee (CWC) met over the party's poor performance in five states, Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said every Congress worker wants Rahul Gandhi to lead the party. However, the new party president will be chosen at next Congress election, he added. Surjewala further said CWC wants Sonia Gandhi to guide the party till organisational elections are held.

165.title: Will always be special: Radhika on 2 years of 'Angrezi Medium'
165.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan on Sunday shared a series of stills from 'Angrezi Medium' on Instagram Stories to mark two years since its release, writing, "Will always be special". The film starred late actor Irrfan Khan. Radhika shared a picture with the late actor along with a heart emoji. The actress also shared a selfie from the first day of shoot.

166.title: He kept calling out my name in the hospital: Bappi Lahiri's son
166.article_body: Late veteran singer-composer Bappi Lahiri's son singer Bappa Lahiri has revealed that his father kept calling out his name when he was admitted to the hospital. Bappa added that he was not in India at the time and his father was supposed to visit him in the US soon. Bappi Lahiri passed away on February 15 aged 69 in Mumbai.

167.title: We know this boy: Suryakumar on Pant scoring fastest Test 50 by an Indian
167.article_body: After Rishabh Pant became the fastest half-centurion for India in Test cricket history, India batter Suryakumar Yadav tweeted, "We know this boy." The 24-year-old India wicketkeeper-batter scored a 28-ball 50 against Sri Lanka in the second and final Test in Bengaluru, breaking Kapil Dev's 40-year-old record. In 1982, Kapil had scored a fifty from 30 deliveries against Pakistan.

168.title: Congress will form 'aapki sarkar' in Haryana: Ex-CM Hooda
168.article_body: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda, while addressing Congress workers on Sunday, said the party will form "aapki sarkar (your government)" in the state. He added, "Somebody will say...AAP...formed a government in Punjab. That's AAP party...not aapki (your) government." He also called to throw out the incumbent BJP-JJP government, saying, "Nobody can stop you if you stand united with me."

169.title: 24-year-old woman pilot flew back 800 Indian students amid Ukraine war
169.article_body: A 24-year-old pilot named Mahasweta Chakraborty flew 800 Indian students back to safety amid the Ukraine war. The Kolkata native reportedly flew six evacuation flights, four from Poland and two from Hungary, between February 27 and March 7. "I salute [the students'] fighting spirit and am extremely proud of having played my part in their journey back home," said Chakraborty.

170.title: Could have responded but observed restraint: Pak PM after India misfires missile
170.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday said that they could have responded to India after its missile landed in their country but they "observed restraint". On March 9, an unarmed Indian missile landed in Pakistan, to which the former said that it was an "accidental firing". Later, Pakistan called for a joint probe "to establish the facts surrounding the incident."

171.title: India beat Germany 3-0 in a shootout at Women's Pro Hockey League
171.article_body: India beat Germany 3-0 in a shootout in second match of their two-legged tie as both teams were tied at 1-1 after 60-minute regulation time at FIH Women's Pro Hockey League in Bhubaneswar on Sunday. India had lost first match 1-2 in a shootout on Saturday. World number nine India secured two points from the match, including a bonus point.

172.title: Russia to ban Instagram tonight, users told to move their pics and videos
172.article_body: Russia has notified Instagram users in the country that the service will cease from midnight on Sunday, advising them to move their photos and videos from Instagram. Russians are being encouraged to switch to Russia's own "competitive internet platforms". This comes after Instagram parent Meta said it'd allow Ukraine users to post messages such as "Death to the Russian invaders".

173.title: 14 wickets fall on Day 2 as SL need 419 more runs to win D-N Test, India need 9 wickets
173.article_body: Sri Lanka ended the second day of the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru at 28/1 in their second innings, needing 419 more runs to win, while India need nine wickets to win. Earlier in the day, India declared their second innings at 303/9, setting Sri Lanka a target of 447. As many as 14 wickets fell on the second day.

174.title: 4 terrorists arrested in MP's Bhopal, were preparing sleeper cell
