174.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad arrested four suspected terrorists in Bhopal on Sunday and seized laptops and religious literature from their possession. They have been said to have links with banned outfit Jamat-e-Mujahideen Bangladesh, a government statement said. They were preparing a sleeper cell to conduct anti-national activities in the future, the statement added.

175.title: Getting eyeballs has been toughest, 'SOTY 2' changed things: Aditya
175.article_body: Actor Aditya Seal said "getting eyeballs" for his work has been the toughest for him in the industry. Aditya added that his films like 'Tum Bin 2' did not succeed because of many reasons like demonetisation. "Things changed with the release of 'Student Of The Year 2' (SOTY 2), it did manage to get people into the cinemas," he stated.

176.title: 179 Jharkhand students stranded in Ukraine return to state
176.article_body: As many as 179 students from Jharkhand who were stranded in Ukraine have returned to the state, officials confirmed on Sunday. Students from districts of Ranchi, East Singhbhum, Dhanbad, Godda, Palamu, Hazaribag and Bokaro, are among the evacuees. On February 25, the Jharkhand government had set up a control room to help families of those stuck in Ukraine.

177.title: Russia using phosphorus bombs that Nazis called 'flaming onion': Ukraine
177.article_body: Russian forces have been accused of using illegal phosphorus weapons in Ukraine. Oleksi Biloshytsky, the head of police in Popasna, around 100 kilometres west of Luhansk city, said that the Russian forces had used the chemical weapon in his area. "It's what Nazis called a 'flaming onion' and that's what Russcists (amalgamation of 'Russians' and 'fascists') are dropping," Biloshytsky added.

178.title: Last reserves of food and water are running out: Ukraine's Mariupol
178.article_body: The City Council of Ukraine's Mariupol on Sunday said that the last reserves of food and water are running out amid a Russian blockade. "There is no electricity, water or heating in the city. There is almost no mobile communication," it claimed. The council also said that Russian forces blockading the city continued to shell non-military targets.

179.title: I don't think about being best tennis player: Nadal on his 16-0 in 2022
179.article_body: Asked if he considers himself the "best tennis player" at present since he defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev twice recently, Rafael Nadal said he doesn't think about that and doesn't care much. "I don't put myself in that- 'I want to be...best,'" he added. The 21-time Grand Slam champion is 16-0 this season, having won three titles so far.

180.title: AirSerbia to reduce flights to Moscow post criticism from EU, Ukraine
180.article_body: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic on Saturday said country's airline, AirSerbia will return to operating one flight a day to Moscow after "the witch hunt" against his country. This comes after EU, Ukraine criticised the Balkan nation and said that AirSerbia is profiting from the Russia-Ukraine war. Since Russia invaded Ukraine, AirSerbia had doubled the number of flights to Moscow.

181.title: His determination is an example for WI: Kraigg on Bonner's 9-hour 123 vs Eng
181.article_body: Following the drawn first West Indies-England Test, West Indies skipper Kraigg Brathwaite praised teammate Nkrumah Bonner, saying his determination is an example for the team. "He's special...has a special mindset," he added. Notably, Bonner's first innings score of 123 runs from 355 balls spanned more than nine hours, which helped his side lead England by 64 runs after first innings.

182.title: Sonia Gandhi to continue as Congress chief, CWC decides after 4.5-hr meeting
182.article_body: Days after its poll debacle in five states, Congress Working Committee on Sunday decided that Sonia Gandhi will continue as the party president. The meeting, which lasted for four-and-half-hours, was attended by Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra,  Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge and P Chidambaram, among others. "We all have faith in her leadership," said Kharge.

183.title: France to offer 4th COVID-19 vaccine dose to all above 80 from Monday
183.article_body: French Prime Minister Jean Castex said government will start offering fourth COVID-19 vaccine doses for all above 80 years of age from Monday, March 14, reported Le Parisien. During an interview with the daily, Castex said the vaccination drive will be extended to those with an immunocompromised system. This comes as France is set to relax COVID-19 restrictions from Monday.

184.title: Pet hamsters can trasmit COVID-19 to humans: Hong Kong study
184.article_body: Hong Kong researchers said pet hamsters can pass COVID-19 to humans and that they were most likely responsible for city's Delta variant outbreak. As per study, 50% from the tested Syrian hamsters in a pet shop and 58% from a warehouse in Hong Kong were tested positive for COVID-19. Team added both locations were ascertained as prime sources of transmission.

185.title: Cooperative sector to contribute hugely in $5 trillion economy goal: Amit Shah
185.article_body: Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the cooperative sector is going to make the largest contribution to PM Narendra Modi's aim of making India a $5 trillion economy. He said a strong cooperative sector will also help realise the dream of Aatmanirbhar Bharat. He added that the cooperative sector will benefit several crore people associated with it.

186.title: After Haryana & Gujarat, MP makes 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free
186.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Sunday declared Anupam Kher starrer 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the state. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "[The film] is a heart-wrenching narration of the pain, suffering, struggle and trauma faced by Kashmiri Hindus in the 90s." The governments of Haryana and Gujarat have already declared the film tax-free.

187.title: Who's a Russian oligarch & why are oligarchs being sanctioned by the West?
187.article_body: An oligarch is a member of a small group with power. In the context of Russian politics, the term was first used to describe some powerful men who amassed immense wealth following the collapse of the USSR. By sanctioning Russian oligarchs, the US and its allies hope that the elite class might pressure President Vladimir Putin to end the war.

188.title: I contested for the 1st time: AAP MLA who defeated Ex-Punjab CM Channi
188.article_body: AAP MLA Labh Singh Ugoke, who defeated Congress' Charanjit Singh Channi from Bhadaur seat, said he contested the Assembly polls for the first time. "It's a new type of politics in which a labourer's son can become MLA. I'll work to improve condition of hospitals and improve quality of education," he added. Ugoke defeated Channi by 37,558 votes.

189.title: Mamata can't run WB peacefully, how can she govern India: Vijayvargiya
189.article_body: BJP's Kailash Vijayvargiya dismissed West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee as potential PM candidate for 2024 Lok Sabha polls, stating that there's no alternative to PM Narendra Modi. "Mamata...is not able to run her own state peacefully, how can...[she]...run [India]," he added. Banerjee had earlier said that BJP's victory in Assembly polls of four states isn't true reflection of people's mandate.

190.title: Iran claims missile attack near US consulate in Iraq's Irbil
190.article_body: Iran on Sunday claimed responsibility for a dozen ballistic missiles that struck near the US consulate in Iraq's Irbil. The attack targeted the Israeli "strategic centre of conspiracy" in the city, it said. It was in retaliation for an Israeli strike in Syria that killed two members of its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, Iran added.

191.title: Gujarat Titans launch their first jersey at Narendra Modi Stadium, share pic
191.article_body: Gujarat Titans, who'll make their debut in IPL 2022, launched their first-ever jersey at Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad ahead of the tournament. Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki, head coach Ashish Nehra, captain Hardik Pandya and BCCI Secretary Jay Shah attended the launch. Gujarat Titans will face Lucknow Super Giants in their IPL 2022 opener on March 28.

192.title: Harry Styles texted stranger 'Love you' thinking it's me: Rosalía
192.article_body: Singer-songwriter Rosalía has revealed that singer Harry Styles once texted her old number which then belonged to a stranger to compliment her song 'Dolerme'. The stranger replied with 'Love you' to which Harry responded with 'Love you too', Rosalía said. She added that the stranger then messaged Harry, "This number [belonged] to someone else before...Don't bother me anymore. Good night."

193.title: Hearing incredible things: Akshay to Anupam on 'The Kashmir Files'
193.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Sunday appreciated veteran actor Anupam Kher's performance in 'The Kashmir Files', tweeting, "Hearing absolutely incredible things." Akshay further wrote that he hopes to watch the film soon, adding that it is amazing to see the audience back to the cinemas in large numbers. 'The Kashmir Files' depicts the mass exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the state.

194.title: Talks with Taliban on operating Kabul airport underway: Turkey
194.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu on Sunday said talks with Taliban on operating Kabul's Hamid Karzai International Airport are still underway. Çavuşoğlu added he is willing to operate the airport with Qatar only if its security demands are met. This comes a day after he met acting Foreign Minister of Afghanistan Amir Khan Muttaqi in southern Turkey.

195.title: Sucking my stomach in since I was 11, wanted no concealing: Jamie on look for new film
195.article_body: Actress Jamie Lee Curtis shared her look from her new film 'Everything Everywhere All at Once', and wrote on Instagram, "My instruction to everybody was: I want no concealing of anything." She said, "I've been sucking my stomach in since I was 11." The 63-year-old actress added, "I...decided to relinquish and release every muscle...that I used to clench."

196.title: Sanctions against Russia will not resolve Ukraine conflict: Turkey
196.article_body: Imposing sanctions on Russia will not resolve the ongoing Ukraine crisis, Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu has said. Çavuşoğlu added that he had discussed the situation in Ukraine with EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell Fontelles at the Antalya Diplomacy Forum. Turkey had previously reiterated that it will not join Western sanctions against Russia.

197.title: I get the feedback that I'm good-looking, it's bizarre: Dino on not getting roles
197.article_body: Model and actor Dino Morea said that people in Bollywood never saw him 'beyond his looks' and that was one of the reasons he was passed up for roles. "I just get the feedback that 'you are good looking'. I find it very bizarre...Being good looking sometimes works against you in Bollywood," said Morea.

198.title: Theatres opened after 2 yrs & 'Gangubai...' rocked box office: Vidya
198.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan in an interview has stated it is amazing that theatres have opened after two years and a female led-film has rocked the box office. "Look at what is happening with 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," the actress added. Vidya further said that female characters are being portrayed as individuals now rather than as "the perfect, ideal woman".

199.title: Actor Sean Penn tests +ve for COVID after coming back from Ukraine
199.article_body: Actor Sean Penn, who recently returned from Ukraine, has tested positive for COVID-19. As per media reports, director Paul Thomas Anderson said the actor had tested positive for COVID-19 while receiving an award at the 2022 Directors Guild of America Awards, which was to be presented by Sean. Sean was in Ukraine to shoot a documentary on the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

200.title: Was being bit of b***h: Campion on Elliott's 'The Power...' criticism
200.article_body: Filmmaker Jane Campion has reacted to actor Sam Elliott's criticism of her film 'The Power of the Dog' and said, "He was being a little bit of a b***h." "It's really unfortunate...because he's really hit the trifecta of misogyny...xenophobia and homophobia," Campion stated. This comes after Elliott had called Campion's film "a piece of s**t" on a podcast.

201.title: We wanted to win vs England, but happy with draw: WI batter Bonner
201.article_body: West Indies batter Nkrumah Bonner said his side expected to win against England in the first Test, however, added they're happy with the draw. "We showed real character the way we bowled...have a lot of positives to take out of this game," he added. Bonner scored 123 runs in the first innings and unbeaten 38 runs in the second innings.

202.title: Earth-forming meteorites may have formed in outer solar system: Study
202.article_body: Japanese researchers suggested that meteorites that helped form Earth may have formed in the outer solar system. Team revealed that these asteroidal materials may have been transported in inner solar system by chaotic mixing during early turbulent phase of solar system. As per study, surface minerals of these outer-belt asteroids may have sourced building blocks of Earth's water and life.

203.title: All parties must exercise restraint over Ukraine: Qatar minister
203.article_body: Qatar's Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani on Sunday called on all parties to exercise restraint and avoid further escalation over situation in Ukraine. In a phone call with his Ukrainian counterpart, Dmytro Kuleba, Al-Thani urged all to resolve disputes through constructive dialogue and diplomatic methods. This comes as the minister will reportedly visit Moscow on Sunday.

204.title: Ex-Union Minister Uma Bharti throws a stone in liquor shop in MP, shares video
204.article_body: Former Union Minister Uma Bharti on Sunday tweeted a video wherein she could be seen throwing a stone in a liquor store in Madhya Pradesh. The former minister, who has been advocating for a liquor ban in the state, tweeted that the shop is located in a workers' settlement and she has warned the authorities to close the store.

205.title: Karisma shares pic with Madhuri, fans say Dil To Pagal Hai 2
205.article_body: Actress Karisma Kapoor on Sunday took to Instagram to share a picture with actress Madhuri Dixit, writing, "Look who I bumped into at the studio, my all-time fav MDji." Madhuri and Karisma had appeared together in the 1997 film 'Dil To Pagal Hai' which also starred Shah Rukh Khan. Several fans wrote in the comments, "Dil To Pagal Hai 2'."

206.title: Big commercial entertainers won't ever go out of style: Kriti Sanon
206.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon in an interview has stated that big commercial entertainers won't ever go out of style, adding that they will keep getting made. "There is a lineup of films, all blockbuster potential, waiting to come," the actress added. Kriti further said that this is a healthy time for actors as many bilingual and trilingual films are being made.

207.title: Sri Lankan govt to hold all-party conference amid economic crisis
207.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has called for an all-party conference on March 23 over the current economic situation in the country, according to local media reports. Sri Lanka's economic crisis began due to the pandemic, leading to a decline in the country's foreign exchange reserves. The crisis has also led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

208.title: We talk about Dhoni being Mr cool but Rohit is cool as cucumber: Irfan
208.article_body: Comparing Rohit Sharma and MS Dhoni, Irfan Pathan said everyone talks about Dhoni being Mr cool but India captain is "cool as a cucumber". He added, "Rohit was given...role of opening the innings [in 2013 Champions Trophy]...that took his career to another level." Irfan further said Rohit changed MI when he replaced Ricky Ponting as captain midway in IPL 2013.

209.title: LIC reports ₹235 crore net profit in Q3 ahead of IPO
209.article_body: IPO-bound LIC's net profit rose from ₹94 lakh in Q3 FY21 to ₹234.9 crore in Q3 FY22 while its net profit between April-December 2021 rose to ₹1,643 crore from ₹7 crore reported last year. First year premiums during Q3 rose 10% YoY to ₹8,748 crore. LIC will offload 31.62 crore shares in the upcoming IPO, its draft papers said.

210.title: Harvard student launches website for Ukrainian refugees after 3 sleepless nights
210.article_body: Avi Schiffmann, a 19-year-old neurophilosophy student at Harvard University, launched the website 'Ukraine Take Shelter' with his friend Marco Burstein to help Ukrainian refugees to find temporary places to stay. It connects Ukrainian refugees with potential hosts and housing from around the world. "We didn't sleep for three days, we got it (website) up as fast as possible," Schiffmann said.

211.title: How has Virat Kohli's batting average changed after every Test?
211.article_body: Virat Kohli's Test average dropped below 50 today for the first time after more than four years. Kohli's batting average crossed 40 for the first time after his 10th Test. His average was 48.03 after 50th Test, while it hit 50 for the first time after 52nd match. Kohli achieved his highest batting average of 55.10 after his 81st Test.

212.title: Sanctions have frozen almost $300 bn of Russia's gold, forex reserves
212.article_body: Sanctions imposed on Russia have frozen around $300 billion of $640 billion that Russia had in its gold and forex reserves, Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said on Sunday. He added that the West was also pressuring China to limit its trade with Russia. Siluanov said Russia will pay roubles to its debt holders until reserves are unfrozen, RIA reported.

213.title: Looking at humanitarian use of sanctioned properties of Russians: UK
213.article_body: British Housing Minister Michael Gove on Sunday said that the UK is looking at whether it can use properties owned by sanctioned individuals in the country for humanitarian purposes. Gove made the comment when asked if the homes of sanctioned oligarchs could be used to house Ukrainian refugees. "We are not talking about permanent confiscation," he added.

214.title: Iran suspends talks with rival Saudi Arabia: Report
214.article_body: Iran has temporarily suspended direct talks with its regional rival Saudi Arabia, Iranian state-linked media reported on Sunday. Notably, the announcement comes a day after Saudi Arabia executed 81 people convicted of crimes ranging from killings to ties to militant groups. The talks began last year and are aimed at defusing tensions between the two countries.

215.title: Fake 'KBC' offering ₹25 lakh prize money busted by Mumbai policeman
215.article_body: A 25-year-old police constable attached to Mumbai's Cyber Police at BKC busted an online fake version of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', which was allegedly offering a prize of ₹25 lakh to the winner. Vijay Jadhav discovered that the voice and image of Amitabh Bachchan were being used to lure people into depositing money to participate in the online lottery.

216.title: 51-yr-old US journalist shot dead by Russian forces in Ukraine: Ukraine police
216.article_body: A former New York Times journalist was shot dead and another injured by Russian forces in Ukraine, said Ukraine's police. The US journalist was identified as 51-year-old Brent Renaud. The New York Times while confirming Brent's death said "Though...contributed to The Times in the past (most recently in 2015) he wasn't on an assignment for...The Times in Ukraine."

217.title: Meta acquired interesting things, it isn't innovative: Gaming veteran Fils-Aimé
217.article_body: Gaming industry veteran Reggie Fils-Aimé said Facebook parent Meta itself is "not an innovative company". He told Bloomberg, "They have either acquired interesting things like Oculus and Instagram, or they've been a fast follower of people's ideas." Fils-Aimé, the former President of Nintendo of America, said the digital future will be driven by smaller companies that are really innovating.

218.title: Putin suffering from 'roid rage' possibly from cancer treatment, claim spies
218.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is suffering from "roid rage" possibly from a steroid treatment for cancer, reports said quoting intelligence sources. Senior figures in the Five Eyes intelligence alliance said Putin's "increasingly erratic behaviour", "bloated face and neck" and his "absurd" social distancing with visitors could be potential side effects of prolonged use of steroids.

219.title: Want to become voice of Goa: AAP leader after winning Benaulim seat
219.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Capt. Venzy Viegas, who won from Benaulim constituency in recently-concluded Goa Assembly polls, said on Sunday that he wishes to become the voice of the state. "The politics of change has begun," he added. Viegas defeated former Goa CM and Trinamool Congress (TMC) candidate Churchill Alemao in the election by a margin of 1,271 votes.

220.title: Parking curbs near B'luru cricket stadium for India-Sri Lanka match
220.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police have issued an advisory for parking of vehicles near the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in view of the India-Sri Lanka match till March 16. Parking along CTI Circle (Cubbon Road) to Dickenson Road, on both sides, is completely banned in this period. However, alternative parking arrangements have been made.

221.title: Didn't expect Ronaldo to score hat-trick vs Spurs: Man Utd's Rangnick
221.article_body: After a 3-2 win over Tottenham Hotspur, Manchester United manager Ralf Rangnick said he did not expect Cristiano Ronaldo to score a hat-trick in the match. "His training session on Thursday was so good...I decided to play him from the start and not have him on the bench," Rangnick said. "In the end, it was the right decision," he added.

222.title: Ex-Pak batter Zaheer Abbas inducted into the PCB Hall of Fame
222.article_body: Ex-Pakistan batter Zaheer Abbas was inducted into the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Hall of Fame on Saturday. Abbas scored 5,062 runs in 78 Tests and 2,572 runs in the 62 ODIs. He scored 108 centuries in his first-class career. Abbas is the third cricketer to be inducted into the PCB Hall of Fame after Fazal Mahmood and Wasim Akram.

223.title: Hope to finish 33.2 km of Pune Metro's Phase-I by Dec-end: Maha Metro
223.article_body: The Maha Metro, the implementing agency for the Pune Metro project, aims at completing 33.2 kilometre of Phase-I by the end of December. It will first focus on completing the stretch from Phugewadi to Shivajinagar. "The good response to Pune Metro rail has put public pressure on us to complete the work," a metro official said.

224.title: 3,00,000 people currently in COVID-19 isolation or quarantine in Hong Kong
224.article_body: About 3,00,000 people in Hong Kong are in COVID-19 isolation or under home quarantine, Hong Kong's Chief Executive Carrie Lam said. Lam said the estimate for quarantined people could be overstated as the isolation period for fully vaccinated individuals was reduced to one week from two last month. Hong Kong officials confirmed over 32,000 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

225.title: How will I get work if people keep recommending their friends in B'wood?: Zareen
225.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan, who made her Bollywood debut in 2010 in 'Veer', said, "How will people like me get work if people keep recommending their friends in Bollywood?" She added, "Since I didn't make much effort to become friends with people from the business...I lacked opportunities." She also said, "The major trend right now is that everybody is everybody's friend."

226.title: Virat Kohli's Test average drops below 50 for 1st time after 40 matches and 4 years
226.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli's Test average has dropped below 50 for the first time after 40 matches and over four years. This comes after Kohli was dismissed for 23 and 13 runs in the ongoing Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, which is his 101st Test. Kohli's average stayed above 50 consecutively from his 61st Test 100th Test match.

227.title: 21-yr-old DU graduate dies by suicide at rented house in Delhi
227.article_body: A 21-year-old Delhi University graduate, Prakhar Yadav died by suicide at his rented accommodation in Delhi's Vijay Nagar area, police said on Sunday. The deceased's body was recovered after his neighbours informed a police head constable about him on Friday evening. According to his roommate Monu Bharti, Yadav had been working in Noida since last week, a police officer said.

228.title: Thailand lays out buffet for elephants as it marks 'Elephant Day'
228.article_body: A buffet was laid out for nearly 60 elephants in Thailand's eastern Chonburi province on Sunday as country marked its annual 'Elephant Day'. Elephants were treated to two tonnes of fruits and vegetables laid out on an eight-metre-wide table at venue. Elephants are a source of national pride for Thailand and are used for labour and transport, among other purposes.

229.title: Narendra Bansode appointed senior VP of Pimpri Chinchwad Congress
229.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad City District Congress Committee has appointed Narendra Bansode as its Senior Vice President. President Kailas Kadam handed the letter over to Bansode at the party's office in the presence of Secretary of All India Congress Committee Prithviraj Sathe. "Congress party's egalitarian ideology has been ingrained in my mind since my childhood," Bansode said.

230.title: Marks on Japanese monkey’s tooth may question human evolution: Study
230.article_body: Scientists from New Zealand, Japan said unusual toothpick-like marks on teeth of wild  Japanese monkeys may have significant implications on human evolution. As per the study, the grooves which were found in ancient human fossils were evidence of use of tools. However, the scientists said Japanese monkeys have not been seen using tools suggesting reassessment of cultural habits in humans.

231.title: Vehicle movement banned on B'luru's Goraguntepalya flyover at night
231.article_body: A ban has been imposed on the movement of vehicles on Bengaluru's Goraguntepalya flyover between midnight and 5 am. Police said the decision was taken as it becomes difficult for them to distinguish between light and heavy vehicles during the night. An expert panel from the Indian Institute of Science had termed the flyover unsafe.

232.title: I was there, police were in awe of his humility: Innov8 founder on Paytm CEO's arrest
232.article_body: Amid reports of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma being arrested for alleged rash driving in February, the founder of Innov8 has come forward as a witness. Dr Ritesh Malik tweeted, "There was no arrest, no negligent driving...the car didn't even have a scratch. I was there and saw...how he managed the situation was fantastic...Police were in awe of his humility."

233.title: I personally felt that fifty was like a century: Shreyas Iyer on his viral celebration
233.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer opened about his viral celebration following his fifty against Sri Lanka in first innings of the Day-Night Test. "I personally felt that fifty was like a century. That's why I celebrated like that. It was like a century feeling for me," he said. Iyer raised his bat with one hand and helmet with another to celebrate.

234.title: Tharoor shares number of Opp'n MLAs, says 'this is why Congress is worth reviving'
234.article_body: Shashi Tharoor on Sunday shared number of MLAs of BJP versus Opposition parties across India, showing Congress with the highest number of lawmakers (753) among Opposition parties. "This is why Congress remains by far the most credible of the national opposition parties. It's also why it's worth reforming and reviving," said Tharoor. A crucial Congress Working Committee meeting is underway.

235.title: Women entrepreneurs display sustainable products at expo in Hyd
235.article_body: Sustainable products, including leaf tableware and vegan coffees, were displayed at 'The Business Women Expo 2022', which is being held in Hyderabad. "We want to address...[use of] single-use plastic, so we took this initiative (leaf tableware)...It [also] gives antioxidants to food," an entrepreneur said describing her product. Expo was inaugurated by TRS leader Kavitha Kalvakuntla on Friday.

236.title: Gurugram authorities plan to launch on-street paid parking in city
236.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) plans to launch a pilot project of on-street paid parking in the city in an effort to resolve the parking woes, officials said. The pilot project will run until multi-level parking facilities are constructed in the city to ease traffic congestion, they added. The GMDA has identified 17 spots for on-street parking.

237.title: Nearly 4 lakh Ukrainians fled to Romania since Russia invaded: Report
237.article_body: Police officials at Ukraine-Romania border on Sunday said a total of 3,97,542 Ukrainians have escaped to Romania since Russian invasion on February 24. As per UN International Organization of Migration (IOM), more than 25 lakh civilians have escaped from Ukraine so far. On the other hand, Russian Defence Ministry said their forces are targeting Ukrainian military and not civilians.

238.title: 1 dead as bus carrying Ukrainians refugees crashes in Italy
238.article_body: A bus carrying about 50 Ukrainian refugees crashed on a highway in Italy on Sunday, leaving one dead and several others injured, the fire service said. The passengers were taken to a nearby police barracks for initial assistance, and would later resume their journey, according to Italy's Interior Ministry. The bus was heading towards Italy's Pescara from Ukraine, it said.

239.title: S Korea records over 3.5 lakh new daily cases for 2nd day in a row
239.article_body: South Korean health authorities on Sunday said the country reported 3,50,190 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, down from 3,83,651 cases from the previous day. As per Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA), 251 deaths were reported in the same period. Meanwhile, South Korean Foreign Ministry extended its advisory against overseas travel till April 13.

240.title: US proposes plan to cut smog pollution from power plants, industries
240.article_body: US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on Friday proposed stringent rules to control and lessen interstate smog pollution from power plants and industries. Named 'Good Neighbour', the plan would aim to cut about 29% emissions of smog-forming nitrogen oxides from power plants by 2026. The agency added that the measures will also target a 15% reduction from other industrial sources.

241.title: Rishabh Pant smashes fastest fifty by an Indian in Test cricket history off 28 balls
241.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has set the record for smashing the fastest fifty by an Indian in Test cricket history, achieving the feat off 28 deliveries against Sri Lanka in the Day-Night Test in Bengaluru. The previous record was held by former India captain Kapil Dev, who had taken 30 balls to score a fifty against Pakistan in 1982.

242.title: Russia threatened Google exec in 2021 to remove anti-Putin app in 24hrs: Report
242.article_body: Russian agents threatened Google's top executive last year to remove an app designed to help register protest votes against President Vladimir Putin within 24 hours, or risk going to prison, The Washington Post reported. Google reportedly moved the executive to a hotel but the agents showed up at her room. As per the Post, Google removed the app next morning.

243.title: Adani, Piramal among 14 firms looking to buy Anil Ambani's Reliance Capital: Report
243.article_body: Adani Finserve, KKR, Piramal Finance and Poonawalla Finance are among the 14 prominent firms that have expressed interest in buying debt-ridden Reliance Capital promoted by Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, PTI reported on Sunday. The last date for submission of bids for the firm was extended to March 25. Last year, RBI superseded Reliance Capital's board in view of payment defaults.

244.title: How could you say no to this?: Rishad Premji on US author's letter to Monroe
244.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji tweeted a letter written by Nobel Prize-winning US author John Steinbeck, to actress Marilyn Monroe in 1955, asking her for an autographed photo for his nephew-in-law. "He's already your slave...This would make him mine...If you'll do this, I'll like you very much," Steinbeck wrote. Premji tweeted, "How could you say no to a letter like this?"

245.title: Video shows ITBP personnel playing kabaddi in snow-clad Himalayas
245.article_body: The ITBP has shared a video on Twitter showing its personnel playing kabaddi in the high Himalayas in Himachal Pradesh. In the 38-second video, ITBP personnel can be seen dressed in their snow gear. "Full of josh, playing in snow...Himveers of Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) playing Kabaddi," the caption of the video read.

246.title: Govt can float LIC IPO without fresh filing till May 12: Reports
246.article_body: The government has time till May 12 to float the LIC IPO without filing fresh papers with SEBI, PTI reported. If the deadline is missed, the government will have to file fresh papers with Q3 FY22 results and an updated embedded value. "We're watching the volatility and will file the red herring prospectus giving price band soon," an official said.

247.title: Russian missile attack at Ukraine military base kills 35, injures 134 others
247.article_body: A Russian missile attack on a Ukrainian military facility near the border with NATO member Poland killed at least 35 people while injuring 134 others on Sunday, reported Reuters while quoting regional governor Maksym Kozytskyi. Ukraine's Defence Minister while confirming the incident said, "Foreign instructors work here…This is a new terrorist attack on peace & security near the EU-NATO border."

248.title: Pune policemen, hawala agent rob businessman of ₹45 lakh, arrested
248.article_body: Thane Police have arrested three Pune policemen for allegedly robbing a businessman of ₹45 lakh, with the help of a hawala agent, who is a relative of the complainant. Upon learning that the businessman was transporting ₹5 crore hawala cash, the agent informed the policemen, who stopped the businessman in Bhiwandi and allegedly took ₹45 lakh, police said.

249.title: Punjab got honest CM in so many years: Kejriwal in Amritsar roadshow
249.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM-elect Bhagwant Mann held a mega roadshow in Amritsar on Sunday to celebrate AAP's victory in the Punjab Assembly polls. "For the first time after so many years, Punjab has now got an honest Chief Minister," Kejriwal said. He added that now all the money will be spent on Punjab and its people.

250.title: India relocates embassy to Poland due to attacks in western Ukraine
250.article_body: India has decided to temporarily relocate its embassy in Ukraine to Poland "in view of the rapidly deteriorating security situation in Ukraine", the Ministry of External Affairs said on Sunday. This was being done due to Russian attacks in the western parts of Ukraine, it added. The situation will be reassessed in the future, the government said.

251.title: I've done films where my heart didn't belong, but respect it: Yami
251.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has stated that she has done certain films even when she was aware that it wasn't something where her heart belongs. She further said that she respects the people who gave her the opportunities, adding that it was still work at the end of the day. "I've evolved a lot as a professional...Opportunities are different," Yami said.

252.title: RCB had bid for Du Plessis with captaincy in mind: Mike Hesson
252.article_body: Revealing why RCB appointed Faf du Plessis as their skipper over others, Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said the franchise had bid for ex-South Africa skipper in IPL mega auction 2022 with captaincy in mind. He explained that RCB wanted to expand on their leadership group with Glenn Maxwell and Virat Kohli being retained due to their huge captaincy experience.

253.title: You've succeeded outside the system: Hansal to 'The Kashmir...' maker Vivek
253.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta on Sunday tweeted, "Congratulations Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri for 'The Kashmir Files'." "You've succeeded outside the system, on your own terms. Ideologically or otherwise I might disagree with your views and films but as a colleague, I must commend you," he added. The film, which was released on Friday, has earned ₹12.05 crore in India so far.

254.title: BCCI ask players to follow NCA's fitness plans during IPL: Report
254.article_body: To ensure optimum fitness ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 and Cricket World Cup 2023, BCCI have reportedly directed players to stick to their fitness plans during IPL as well. The decision has been taken after BCCI reportedly learnt that players used to avoid their NCA-made fitness plans during the IPL and followed ones given by their respective franchises.

255.title: We found ourselves in tricky spots, but didn't panic: Root on 1st WI Test
255.article_body: Talking about their first Test against West Indies, which ended in a draw, England captain Joe Root said he's really proud of the players for their performance in the game. "From that first hour, we found ourselves in tricky spots...Throughout the game, we got better and better...Leach was great...Zak showed a huge amount of character to stand up," stated Root.

256.title: Post victory BJP unmasks by cutting EPF interest: Mamata Banerjee
256.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the BJP-led Centre for slashing the interest rate on the Employees Provident Fund deposits. "After victory in UP, BJP comes out with its gift card immediately! It at once unmasks itself by proposing to slash the interest rate on EPF deposits to a four-decade low nadir," CM Banerjee tweeted.

257.title: Have trouble sitting idle, sitting quietly for 5 mins feels like waste of time: Nooyi
257.article_body: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi at the Jaipur Literature Festival 2022 spoke about what motivated her. She said, "When I sit quietly, I feel I have wasted five minutes of my time. I'm constantly thinking about how to change the world or to help somebody...I have trouble sitting idle. That's why meditation has never been a part of my life."

258.title: Vicky wishes 'Uri' director Aditya Dhar on b'day, shares pic from set
258.article_body: Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram to wish 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' director Aditya Dhar on his birthday. He shared a picture from the set of the 2019 action drama and wrote, "Happy birthday mere Bhai. Lots of love!" Responding to his post, Aditya wrote, "Love you!!" Vicky and Aditya have teamed up for another film titled, 'The Immortal Ashwatthama'.

259.title: She tries to do more than she has to: WV Raman on Smriti's 123 in WC
259.article_body: Talking about Smriti Mandhana's 119-ball 123 against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, ex-India Women head coach WV Raman said the India opener always tries to surpass herself. "She tries to do more than she has to but here she didn't get into that mode...she was calm," he stated. "It was a fabulous innings," he further said.

260.title: Jagdev's membership was cancelled over 3 months ago: BJD MP Misra
260.article_body: Biju Janata Dal (BJD) has denied links with MLA Prashant Jagdev who's accused of ramming his car into a crowd that injured 22 people in Khordha, Odisha. BJD MP Pinaki Misra said, "BJD membership of Jagdev was cancelled more than three months ago after his suspension by party president Naveen Patnaik." He assured that "law will take its own course".

261.title: Valuables worth ₹29 lakh stolen from Mumbai jeweller's home, 5 held
261.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested five people following a robbery at a jeweller's house in which gold ornaments and cash worth ₹29.60 lakh were looted. Those arrested include the jeweller's estranged brother who allegedly masterminded the burglary. According to police, three armed men had barged into the house on March 10 and threatened the jeweller's family members before fleeing with valuables.

262.title: Gurugram civic body demolishes 40 shanties in 2-day drive
262.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has demolished 40 shanties in Sector 40, Sector 54, Sector 56, and Sector 57 during a two-day drive last week, officials said. Around two acres of prime civic land were recovered during the drive, officials said. There was no major resistance from the locals during the drive, they added.

263.title: I'd pay to watch him bowl: Irfan on Bumrah's 8th 5-wicket Test haul vs SL
263.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah for his eighth five-wicket Test haul against Sri Lanka in second Test, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "I would pay to watch Bumrah bowl. What a bowler!" The India pacer, who registered bowling figures of 10-4-24-5, dismissed Niroshan Dickwella (21) for his fifth wicket. Notably, the Sri Lankan wicketkeeper-batter's wicket was Bumrah's 300th international wicket.

264.title: 21-yr-old Indian fighting Russian forces in Ukraine willing to return to India: Report
264.article_body: R Sainikhesh, a 21-year-old aerospace engineering student from Tamil Nadu who joined the Ukrainian paramilitary force as a volunteer to fight the Russian forces, has reportedly expressed his willingness to return to his home in Coimbatore. Sainikhesh's father spoke to him three days ago, during which Sainikhesh had expressed his willingness to return home, PTI reported quoting his family sources.

265.title: UK to offer support for probe on Russian 'war crimes' in Ukraine
265.article_body: UK Deputy PM Dominic Raab will visit International Criminal Court in The Hague on Monday to offer support for probing alleged war crimes by Russia in Ukraine, UK government said. "Russian commanders carrying out war crimes should know they can't act with impunity," Raab said. Raab will also meet ambassadors from other countries to build coalition focused on aiding investigation.

266.title: Gujarat gets new sports policy, to set up 4 new High Performance Centres
266.article_body: The Gujarat government has unveiled its sports policy (2022-27) in which the state will get four new High Performance Centre (HPCs) for elite athletes out of which one will be exclusively for para-athletes. The policy also promises to set up a sports goods manufacturing cluster in the state and encourages private sector participation in setting up HPCs and others.

267.title: Unification of MCDs needed as Delhi govt blocking funds: Gambhir
267.article_body: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir has said that the unification of municipal corporations of Delhi (MCDs) has been necessitated due to state government's blocking of funds given by the Centre for the civic bodies. Notably, the announcement of dates for municipal polls in Delhi was postponed following a communication from the Centre to State Election Commission on unification of civic bodies.

268.title: Dhoni was completely opposite of what I thought captaincy would've looked like: Faf du Plessis
268.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis said that MS Dhoni was the complete opposite of what he thought captaincy would've looked like. "I came to...CSK...and I was like 'This guy is completely different than I thought what it should be'," he added. "What it taught me was...there were different styles, but it's important that you...have your own style," he stated.

269.title: Andhra boy lives with mother's body for 4 days thinking she's asleep; goes to school daily
269.article_body: A 10-year-old boy in Andhra Pradesh stayed with his mother's dead body for four days, thinking she was sleeping. He went to school every day by dressing up himself, ate snacks at home and slept beside his mother. The incident was reported after the boy called his uncle to inform him about a foul smell emanating from his mother's body.

270.title: Ambedkar musical at JLN Stadium to go on till March 24: Delhi govt
270.article_body: The musical on the life of BR Ambedkar will go on till March 24 at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, Delhi, after receiving a "tremendous response" from the public, Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's office said. The script of the musical comprises social commentary on the plight of the Dalit community. The musical was scheduled to end on March 12 earlier.

271.title: Man arrested for raping 2 minor daughters in Maharashtra's Palghar
271.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Sunday for allegedly raping his two minor daughters, currently aged six and 12, repeatedly since 2019 after their mother's death, police said. A complaint was registered after the victims approached an NGO. The victims told police that he would point a knife and threaten to kill them whenever they resisted.

272.title: Shimron Hetmyer sports pink hair as he joins RR for IPL 2022, franchise shares pic
272.article_body: Shimron Hetmyer has sported pink hair as he joined Rajasthan Royals for IPL 2022. The franchise shared a picture of Hetmyer joining the team and wrote, "Love is in the hair...Welcome home!" "West Indians bring a very spicy flair to IPL," a fan commented. Hetmyer was bought by RR for ₹8.5 crore in the IPL mega auction.

273.title: Gandhi family important for Congress' unity: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
273.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that the Gandhi family is important for Congress' unity. He added that Rahul Gandhi should once again become the party chief. On the party's recent loss in Punjab polls, Gehlot said, "It was our mistake that due to internal conflict we lost the assembly elections in Punjab."

274.title: Ranbir-Alia's new house to have a room dedicated to Rishi Kapoor: Report
274.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's new house in Mumbai will reportedly have a special room dedicated to his late father Rishi Kapoor. The Kapoor family has preserved each and every memory of the late actor, including a bookshelf, his favourite chair, and other things, the report quoted a source as saying. All these things will be kept in the room.

275.title: Was nice to rebuild with Beth Mooney: Ellyse Perry on win vs NZ
275.article_body: Following a 141-run win against New Zealand Women in the Women's ODI World Cup, Australia Women all-rounder Ellyse Perry said it was nice to rebuild the innings with batter Beth Mooney. Australia Women were down to 56/3, however, Perry, Mooney, Tahlia McGrath and Ashleigh Gardner powered Australia to 269 runs. In reply, New Zealand were bowled out on 128 runs.

276.title: Poor batting performance from us: NZ captain Devine on loss vs Aus
276.article_body: After a 141-run defeat against Australia Women in the Women's ODI World Cup, New Zealand captain Sophie Devine said that her side put up a poor batting performance in the match. In reply to Australia's 269 runs, New Zealand Women were bowled out on 128 runs. "The way Australians set it up (with the bat), that's the blueprint," Devine added.

277.title: Don't see Marvel going from Hugh to me: Daniel on rumours of playing Wolverine
277.article_body: Actor Daniel Radcliffe, responding to rumours of portraying the character of Wolverine, stated that he doesn't see Marvel going from actor Hugh Jackman to him. The actor added, "But who knows? Prove me wrong, Marvel." Daniel further said that people have been congratulating him on the news about playing Wolverine but he doesn't know anything about it.

278.title: Terrific decision by RCB to appoint Du Plessis as captain: Gavaskar
278.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that Royal Challengers Bangalore took a terrific decision by appointing Faf du Plessis as their captain for IPL 2022. "Loads of captaincy experience, loads of leadership quality you see in Du Plessis. I am not surprised at all," Gavaskar stated. Du Plessis was bought by RCB for ₹7 crore in IPL 2022 mega auction.

279.title: Why is letter 'Z' being used by Russians to show support to the war in Ukraine?
279.article_body: The letter 'Z' is being used by Russian politicians, influencers and others to show support to President Vladimir Putin's actions in Ukraine. Russian Defence Ministry explained that the 'Z' represents a number of slogans that begin with the Russian word for 'for' (Za), like 'For Victory' or 'For Peace'. The symbol has also earlier been used to intimidate government critics.

280.title: 5 members of family killed, 1 injured as car hits culvert in Andhra Pradesh
280.article_body: Five members of a family, including a six-month-old baby, died and another person was injured after the car they were travelling in lost control and crashed into a culvert in Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district on Sunday, police said. The deceased, all residents of HUDA colony in Hyderabad, were on their way to West Godavari district to attend a family function.

281.title: I won't mind if people call me 'Baahubali' star forever: Prabhas
281.article_body: Actor Prabhas has said that he won't mind if people call him a 'Baahubali' star for the rest of his life. "'Baahubali' gave me so many things...The issue is the expectations set after 'Baahubali'," the actor added. Prabhas further said that there is definitely some kind of pressure after being recognised in the whole country and not just one state.

282.title: Mumbai BJP workers burn copies of police notice sent to Fadnavis
282.article_body: The BJP workers in Mumbai on Sunday protested against a police notice sent to former CM Devendra Fadnavis in connection with the alleged illegal tapping of phones. They also burnt copies of the police notice. Several BJP leaders gathered outside Fadnavis's home in south Mumbai where a cyber police team reached to record his statement in this case.

283.title: Dollar-denominated debt is bad idea, exposes one to Fed's moods: Zoho CEO
283.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that dollar-denominated debt is a bad idea. "They leave companies and the country exposed to the Fed's (the US' Federal Reserve) mood swings," he explained. Vembu was commenting on a Twitter thread by Human Rights Foundation's Alex Gladstein. "The fiat/petrodollar system can be considered a form of neocolonialism," Gladstein wrote in the tweet.

284.title: Faced ups & downs on my own: Zareen on being called 'Salman Khan actress'
284.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan, who made her debut in 2010 with Salman Khan-starrer film 'Veer', spoke about being tagged as a 'Salman Khan actress' and said that she'll forever be grateful to him for making her a part of the industry. "But that's about it...I've faced the ups and downs on my own and I've dealt with my struggles," she added.

285.title: Kohli needs to play as much as possible with full face of bat: Gavaskar
285.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the 33-year-old needs to try and eliminate the shots that are getting him out. "That shot he played [during India's first innings in ongoing Bengaluru Test] wasn't the shot he should have played. [Kohli needs to] play as much as possible with the full face of the bat," stated Gavaskar.

286.title: Union Minister's sons booked for linking Sharad Pawar to Dawood Ibrahim
286.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane's sons, Nitesh and Nilesh, have been booked for accusing NCP supremo Sharad Pawar of having links with the fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim. The complaint was filed by NCP leader Suraj Chavan, Mumbai Police said. Earlier on Saturday, Chavan had questioned Nilesh's demand for the resignation of state Minority Development Minister Nawab Malik.

287.title: BJP propagated Cong as a Muslim party: Rajasthan CM
287.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said BJP propagated Congress "as a Muslim party on social media". "During polls, religion comes to the forefront while issues of inflation and jobs take a back seat for BJP," he added. We lost the Assembly elections in Punjab due to internal conflict, Gehlot said.

288.title: Forced to change our statement by police: Wife of deceased tribal
288.article_body: After Manuram Nureti was killed in a 'police encounter' in Bastar, his wife Manvati wrote to Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel alleging that they were being "forced to change their statement" in favour of the police. The police had labelled the 26-year-old a 'Maoist' but later retracted their own claim stating that he was "a normal villager...killed in a crossfire".

289.title: Delhi railway reservation services to be inactive on Sunday late night
289.article_body: The Delhi Passenger Reservation System (PRS) will remain inactive for about 3.5 hours between 11:45 pm on March 13 and 3:15 am on March 14, said Indian Railways on Sunday. The services such as reservation of tickets, cancellations, internet booking, charting, PRS enquiry on 139 will not be accessible to the public during this time.

290.title: Female representation in Indian judiciary 'abysmal': Justice Banerjee
290.article_body: Justice Indira Banerjee said the representation of women in the Indian judiciary has been "abysmal" since independence. "Delhi High Court has seven women judges, out of a total of 45. Calcutta High Court has five women judges, out of 39 judges," she said. Only 11.8% of incumbent high court judges are women, said Chief Justice of India NV Ramana.

291.title: Wedding procession attacked in UP for playing song praising PM Modi, CM Yogi
291.article_body: The members of a wedding procession were allegedly beaten up and their vehicles were vandalised by unidentified miscreants in Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya for playing an election-themed song praising PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath. The accused allegedly escaped with cash worth ₹2 lakh and jewellery. Police said a case has been registered and search is underway to trace attackers.

292.title: Notice B'wood's silence on 'The Kashmir Files', their time is up: Kangana
292.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Sunday appreciated Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' on social media, adding that there's pin-drop silence in Bollywood about it. She also appreciated the film for breaking myths about bringing audiences to theatres. Kangana further wrote, "Bullydawood aur unke chamche sadme mein chale gaye hain (Bollywood bullies and their cronies are in shock)...Their time is upp!"

293.title: Anupam Kher starrer 'The Kashmir Files' declared tax-free in Gujarat
293.article_body: The Gujarat government has declared 'The Kashmir Files', starring actor Anupam Kher, as tax-free in the state. The film's maker Vivek Agnihotri thanked Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel. Earlier, Haryana had announced the tax-free status for the film and asked cinemas and multiplexes to not charge state GST on the movie.

294.title: Delhi's Class 9, 11 students to be promoted as per 2020-21 policy
294.article_body: Delhi's Class 9 and 11 students will be promoted based on the promotion policy of 2020-21, the Delhi Directorate of Education said. All government, government-aided and private schools are required to follow the policy. Results of Classes 9 and 11 will be calculated for promotion with passing criteria of 33% in each of the five subjects students are studying.

295.title: Organisational failure to blame for UP poll defeat: Shivpal Yadav
295.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) chief Shivpal Singh Yadav said on Sunday that while the atmosphere was conducive for party to win in UP Assembly elections, it suffered from organisational failure. Yadav, whose party had allied with Samajwadi Party (SP) for polls, added that they welcome people's mandate and will work towards strengthening the organisation. SP won 111 seats in polls.

296.title: Actress Rupaa Dutta held for pickpocketing at fair; kept a diary of her theft record
296.article_body: Bengali actress Rupaa Dutta, who had once wrongly accused Anurag Kashyap of sending her inappropriate messages, has been arrested for allegedly pickpocketing at a Kolkata book fair. The police found ₹65,760 from her bag and a diary in which she had maintained an account of her stealing. Rupaa admitted that she was picking the pocket at the crowded fair.

297.title: NIA arrests 6 people for trafficking Rohingya Muslims into India
297.article_body: The NIA arrested six people who were allegedly part of a syndicate involved in the illegal trafficking of Rohingya Muslims into Indian territory, an official said. The network was operating in the border areas of West Bengal, Assam and Meghalaya as well as other parts of the country, the official added.

298.title: Make all efforts to bring back mortal remains of Indian student who died in Ukraine: PM
298.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security to review India's security preparedness and the prevailing global scenario in the context of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. During the meeting, PM Modi directed that all possible efforts should be made to bring back the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa, who died in Ukraine.

299.title: Kyiv is always beautiful, even during war: Zelenskyy's advisors in video from Kyiv
299.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's close advisors recently shared a video from the country's capital, Kyiv, on social media. In a tweet, Mykhailo Podolyak, an Advisor to the Head of the President's Office, wrote, "Kyiv is always beautiful. Even during wartime." A correspondent also quoted them as saying, "It's a shame the city is so empty but we did find coffee!"

300.title: Naomi Osaka breaks down after woman in crowd says 'You suck', video surfaces
300.article_body: Naomi Osaka broke down in the post-match interview after her defeat against Veronika Kudermetova in round of 64 of Indian Wells Masters. Earlier, a woman in the crowd shouted, "Naomi, you suck." Osaka said being heckled didn't bother her, but an old video of Serena Williams and Venus Williams being heckled at the same tournament replayed in her mind.

301.title: I find things chilly, I'm thin: World's largest air-conditioning firm Daikin's CEO
301.article_body: Masanori Togawa, the 73-year-old CEO of the world's largest air-conditioning company Daikin, while speaking about his personal air-conditioning usage, said, "I tend to find things chilly; I'm thin and don't have enough muscle!" He told Bloomberg, "But we're based in Osaka, which is brutally hot during the summer. There's no way we can survive there without air conditioning."

302.title: People in UP feel it's their own govt, not of some particular community: Piyush Goyal
302.article_body: Following BJP’s victory in four states including UP, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said that people in UP now feel that it is their "own" government and not the government of a particular community. Commenting on BJP’s performance in Punjab, Goyal stated that the BJP has increased its influence in the state significantly.

303.title: He's like my real brother: Zeeshan on 'Bloody Brothers' co-star Jaideep
303.article_body: Actor Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub has said actor Jaideep Ahlawat is like his real brother. "It's been 11-12 years that I have known him," he added. Zeeshan Ayyub, who shares screen space with Jaideep in 'Bloody Brothers', added that they got time to understand each other more while working on the show. "We...ended up making great memories," he said.

304.title: Looking forward to playing with Bumrah: MI's Mills ahead of IPL 2022
304.article_body: MI pacer Tymal Mills, who was bought by the franchise for ₹1.5 crore in IPL mega auction 2022, said he's looking forward to playing with Jasprit Bumrah in upcoming season of IPL . "Had the chance to spend a little bit of time with Bumrah during the World Cup," he added. The England pacer had previously represented RCB in IPL.

305.title: Over 55,000 cases settled in Rachakonda during Lok Adalat session
305.article_body: As many as 55,772 cases in Rachakonda Police Commissionerate were settled during National Lok Adalat at the Ranga Reddy District Court on Saturday. Of the cases settled, 51,318 were Disaster Management Act and e-petty cases, 3,025 cases had been filed under IPC and 1,429 cases were related to drunken driving. Lok Adalat was supervised by Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat.

306.title: 3 arrested for selling rice from ration shops in black market in Pune
306.article_body: Three people have been arrested in the Pune district for allegedly selling rice and wheat from government ration shops at higher prices in the black market. A truck carrying 358 wheat bags and 605 rice bags, all worth ₹28.29 lakh, was also seized from them. The Pimpri Chinchwad Police has also booked five others in this connection.

307.title: Pune Metro's Bhosari station's name creating confusion: Commuters
307.article_body: Commuters have said that Pune Metro's Bhosari station's name is "creating confusion" as it's located at a distance from residential areas. One local said that his relatives took an auto to reach Bhosari which is five-six km away from Bhosari station, as the station is in Nashik Phata. A Maha-Metro spokesperson said that they're thinking of changing Bhosari station's name.

308.title: Anand Mahindra shares video of Cong leader Deora's music performance, calls him 'cool'
308.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video featuring Congress leader Milind Deora, where the latter can be seen playing the guitar onstage at the Mahindra Blues Festival. Mahindra also mentioned that Deora goes by the stage name of MD Mississippi. He wrote, "His party is the INC, & with him, the 'C' stands for Cool!"

309.title: There's lack of confidence: Wasim Jaffer on Virat Kohli's form
309.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal in the first innings against Sri Lanka in the ongoing pink-ball Test, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said, "Once Kohli gets a hundred...I am quite sure that we will get to see the old Kohli." Jaffer added, "[Currently], there is a lack of confidence. The kind of runs that we expect from Kohli [are] not seen."

310.title: Mumbai's maximum temperature rises to 38.9°C, highest in Maharashtra
310.article_body: The maximum temperature in Mumbai on Sunday rose to 38.9°C, which is 5.4°C above normal. The city's maximum temperature is also the highest reported in Maharashtra. People shared memes online about the rising temperatures. "I feel like I am in the Sahara desert," a user wrote on Twitter.

311.title: Ukrainians who told Russian ship 'go f*** yourself' honoured with postage stamp
311.article_body: Ukraine is honouring 13 of its soldiers who told a Russian warship "go f*** yourself!" by releasing a postage stamp, the country's First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Emine Dzheppar said. "The sketch by artist Boris Groh...will soon be published by Ukraine's state postal company," said Dzheppar. The soldiers had famously refused to surrender Snake Island to Russian forces.

312.title: 2 kill man who objected to their eve-teasing, smoking in B'luru
312.article_body: The police are searching for two brothers who allegedly killed a 19-year-old man who had repeatedly objected to the duo's eve-teasing and smoking near his house in Bengaluru. The duo had reportedly got enraged after the deceased complained to their father about the same and had attacked him. The duo had also apparently mocked the sister of the deceased's friend.

313.title: Big B signed papers for Amjad's surgery after accident: Shehla Khan
313.article_body: Shehla Khan recalled the time when she and her late actor-husband Amjad Khan met with an accident in Maharashtra's Sawantwadi. She revealed that Amjad had to be shifted to Goa because a mob had gathered outside the hospital in Sawantwadi. "That's when Amitabh (Bachchan) ji gave his signature for...doctors to proceed with...tracheostomy (a surgical procedure to ease breathing)," Shehla added.

314.title: Ukraine to adopt crop sowing campaign to ensure food security: PM
314.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal said on Sunday that the country will adopt crop sowing campaign in a bid to ensure food security amid the Russian invasion. Shmyhal added that while Ukraine has sufficient volume of basic food products for next few months, it must "think about the future". Notably, Ukraine has also banned export of wheat and other food staples.

315.title: Jasprit Bumrah takes his first Test five-wicket haul on Indian soil
315.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah today completed his first five-wicket haul in Test cricket on Indian soil. The 28-year-old registered bowling figures of 10-4-24-5 in Sri Lanka's first innings in the ongoing Day-Night Test in Bengaluru. Overall, it is Bumrah's eighth five-wicket haul in Test cricket. Sri Lanka were dismissed for 109 runs in the first innings.

316.title: Nawazuddin is among the best actors in the country: Bhumi Pednekar
316.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar in an interview has called actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui one of the best actors in the country, adding that he is a stalwart in cinema. "I have waited long for an opportunity to work with Nawaz sir...I am going to learn so much from him," Bhumi added. The two will be seen together in the upcoming film 'Afwaah'.

317.title: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 7.9%
317.article_body: Morgan Stanley has cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 by 50 basis points to 7.9% and raised retail inflation projection to 6%. The firm also expects current account deficit to widen to a 10-year high of 3% of GDP. High oil prices, trade and tighter financial conditions are expected to affect the Indian economy in FY23.

318.title: Virat Kohli imitates Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action, video goes viral
318.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli imitating Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action during an innings break on the first day of the second Test against Sri Lanka has gone viral. Kohli was also seen imitating actions of other bowlers. Cricketer-turned-commentator Irfan Pathan commented that Kohli makes the atmosphere of the dressing room "amazing".

319.title: Russia conducts airstrike on Ukrainian military base near Poland border
319.article_body: Russia launched an airstrike on a Ukrainian military base in Yavoriv which lies just about 25 km from the Polish border, authorities in Lviv said on Sunday. "According to preliminary data, they fired eight missiles," said the authorities. "There are no dead but information about the injured and wounded is being clarified," said a Ukrainian official.

320.title: Startups must help India become self-reliant in energy, defence: Goyal
320.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal urged startups to help India become self-reliant in energy and defence sectors. "The present Ukraine-Russia crisis is a wakeup call for all of us, not to be dependent on crude oil and defence equipment," he said. Giving an example of how startups dealt with COVID-19 crisis, he said, "Every crisis can be converted into an opportunity."

321.title: One of the scariest moments of my life, I suffered a blood clot in my brain: Hailey
321.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber, singer Justin Bieber's wife, confirmed on Instagram that she was hospitalised after suffering stroke-like symptoms. The 25-year-old wrote, "I suffered a very small blood clot to my brain, which caused a small lack of oxygen, but my body passed it on its own." She went on to call it "one of the scariest moments" of her life.

322.title: US man goes to Ukraine to save daughter & grandson, says 'That's what dads do'
322.article_body: A US man has gone to Ukraine to help his daughter and grandson escape. William Hubbard flew to Poland and crossed the border to Ukraine on foot before joining his daughter and 8-month-old grandson near Kyiv. On Friday, the three reached the border at Slovakia. "That's what dads do. They take care of their family," Hubbard said.

323.title: Reports on CEO's arrest for rash driving exaggerated, no harm was caused: Paytm
323.article_body: Responding to reports of Paytm founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's arrest and subsequent bail in a case of rash driving in February, a company spokesperson called it a "minor incident". The spokesperson added that no harm was caused to any person or property due to it and that media reports claiming the nature of the arrest are exaggerated.

324.title: Woman raped inside bus in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar; 2 arrested
324.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly raping a woman inside a bus in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar. A search is underway to find another accused, Dhar SP said. Police said bus driver, conductor and cleaner did not drop the woman at her destination Longsari. After all other passengers left, the accused stopped the bus at a secluded place and raped her.

325.title: No dirty water will flow into Yamuna by December-end, says NMCG official
325.article_body: No dirty water will be flowing into the Yamuna by December-end as all drains carrying sewage into the river will be tapped, a senior NMCG official said. There are 18 drains that deliver dirty water into the Yamuna and plans are afoot to tap these drains and divert dirty water to sewage treatment plants, NMCG Director-General, G Asok Kumar, said.

326.title: Thousands of Russian tourists stuck in Thailand amid Ukraine war
326.article_body: Thousands of Russian tourists running short of cash are reportedly stranded in Thailand as they are unable to return due to various sanctions and cancelled flights over war in Ukraine. There are about 6,500 Russian tourists stuck in Phuket, Surat Thani, Krabi and Pattaya, in addition to 1,000 Ukrainians, said the Governor of Tourism Authority of Thailand.

327.title: US authorises $200 million for additional weapons to Ukraine
327.article_body: US government on Saturday said that it has given "immediate" authorisation $200 million for additional arms and equipment to Ukraine for its defence amid Russia's invasion of the country. US State Secretary Antony Blinken said that this will help Ukraine meet "armoured, airborne and other threats it's facing". This brings US aid to Ukraine since January 2021 to $1.2 billion.

328.title: You got BMW within 1 year, I can't buy 2nd hand Porsche?: Ashneer to BharatPe CEO
328.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Sunday in a tweet responded to the claims of his "lavish lifestyle", including owning a Porsche car. "I am proud Suhail Sameer (BharatPe's CEO) that within 1 year of joining BharatPe you could buy BMW Z4 convertible sports car," Ashneer tweeted. He added, "Ironic that you believe...as Founder (I) can't even afford a 2nd hand Porsche. Touché!!"

329.title: UK govt offers ₹35,000/month to residents to house Ukrainian refugees
329.article_body: Britain will pay its citizens £350 (around ₹35,000) per month if they offer Ukrainian refugees a spare room or property for a minimum period of six months. The government said the new scheme called "Homes for Ukraine" will allow refugees to come to Britain even if they don't have family ties. Notably, about 2 million people have already fled Ukraine.

330.title: 38 held from fake Gurugram call centre for extortion on pretext of loan recovery
330.article_body: Police busted a fake call centre in Gurugram's Sector 20 and arrested 38 people. The accused used to allegedly extort money from loan borrowers by threatening to send their morphed photos and videos to friends and relatives on pretext of recovering the loan amount. Police claimed the accused extorted nearly ₹2 crore till date. They called around 700 people regularly.

331.title: PM Modi chairs high-level meeting on India's security preparedness
331.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a high-level meeting to review India's security preparedness and the prevailing global scenario in the context of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. Union Ministers Rajnath Singh, S Jaishankar and Nirmala Sitharaman were seen taking part in the meeting with PM Modi. NSA Ajit Doval and Foreign Secretary Harsh V Shringla also attended the meeting.

332.title: Wasn't getting the kind of work I wanted: Jatin Sarna on battling depression
332.article_body: 'Sacred Games' actor Jatin Sarna said that the last few years were quite hard and depressing for him. "I wasn't getting the kind of work I wanted...I felt...nothing was happening around me and started feeling...depressed...Moreover, I was staying alone," he added. Jatin said he didn't take "any clinical help" but "a year of introspection" and "close friends" helped him heal.

333.title: Bihar starts survey to prepare exclusive environment plan for all 38 districts
333.article_body: The Bihar government is in the process of preparing an exclusive environment plan for all 38 districts of the state to address the local environmental issues, BSPCB Member Secretary, S Chandrasekar, said. BSPCB has engaged an agency to conduct a survey in all the districts to prepare the district environment plan and the agency has started the work, he added.

334.title: 19 presumed dead as boat carrying 23 migrants capsizes near Libya
334.article_body: Authorities have said that 19 people are missing and presumed dead after a boat carrying about 23 migrants capsized in Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Libya on Saturday. Three people have been rescued and sent to the hospital, while one body has been retrieved, Libya's coast guard said. The boat had set off from Tobruk, the coast guard added.

335.title: Mumbai woman injured while trying to resist chain snatcher inside running train
335.article_body: A woman sustained injuries on her neck while trying to resist a suspected chain snatcher inside a running train in Mumbai. The woman was travelling to Churchgate in women's coach. When the train halted at Charni Road railway station, the accused entered the coach and tried to steal her gold chain. The woman resisted and chased the thief, who escaped.

336.title: PM Bennett did not ask Zelenskyy to take Putin's deal: Israel, Ukraine
336.article_body: A media report claiming that Israel PM Naftali Bennett suggested Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to give in to Russian demands was denied by both countries. "At no point did PM Bennett advise President Zelenskyy to take a deal from Putin," said an Israeli official. A Ukrainian adviser said Israel "does not offer Ukraine to agree to any demands" of Russia.

337.title: Arvind Kejriwal, Bhagwant Mann visit Golden Temple in Amritsar ahead of roadshow
337.article_body: Punjab CM designate Bhagwant Mann and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday visited the Golden Temple in Amritsar, ahead of their roadshow to mark the party's victory in Punjab polls. Mann received Kejriwal and party leader Manish Sisodia at Amritsar airport today. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM on March 16.

338.title: Shatrughan Sinha, Babul Supriyo to fight for TMC in West Bengal bypolls: Mamata
338.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday took to Twitter to announce that veteran actor and former Union Minister Shatrughan Sinha will be TMC's candidate in Lok Sabha by-election from Asansol constituency. Mamata further stated that singer and former Union Minister Babul Supriyo will be the party's candidate in Assembly by-election from Ballygunge seat.

339.title: Massive fire that broke out at Kolkata tannery yet to be extinguished after 16 hrs
339.article_body: The massive fire which broke out at a tannery in Meher Ali Lane in Tangra area of West Bengal's Kolkata on Saturday night, is yet to be extinguished even after over 16 hours. Officials said firefighters haven't been able to enter the godown due to the presence of some highly inflammable materials inside. Two fire brigade personnel have sustained injuries.

340.title: Punjab win gives AAP, our model of governance national recognition: Manish Sisodia
340.article_body: AAP leader Manish Sisodia said that the party’s massive victory in Punjab gives national recognition to the AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal’s model of governance. Sisodia added that when a political party becomes a credible alternative it's bound to emerge as a winner. "Right now, our priority is the people of Punjab. We will focus on fulfilling our promises," Sisodia stated.

341.title: At least 60 killed, dozens injured as Cargo train crashes in Congo
341.article_body: At least 60 people were killed and dozens injured after a cargo train crashed in Congo on Friday. The passengers had reportedly boarded the train illegally. "Seven of the carriages ended up in the ravine," said Clementine Lutanda, the local administrator. The accident occurred when the train fell off the track while going up a slope.

342.title: Ashneer Grover denies owning ₹10-cr dining table, says 'It's not even worth 0.5% of that'
342.article_body: Ashneer Grover has denied a report claiming he spent ₹10 crore on a dining table, saying, "It's not even worth 0.5% of that". He tweeted, "Is it a space rocket? Is it a time machine?...I don't hold Guinness World Record for the most expensive table...Press – don't fall for BharatPe Board (undisclosed sources) lies – you'll lose credibility like them."

343.title: WI earn draw vs Eng in 1st Test despite losing 4 wickets for 8 runs on final day
343.article_body: WI's Jason Holder and Nkrumah Bonner played a total of 239 deliveries on the final day of the first Test against England as the match ended in a draw. Joe Root slammed his 24th Test century in their second innings to help England set a target of 286 runs. WI were reduced to 67/4 before ending game at 147/4.

344.title: China's new local COVID-19 cases triple amid its worst outbreak
344.article_body: China reported 1,807 new local symptomatic coronavirus cases, more than triple than what was reported the previous day, the National Health Commission said on Sunday as the country faces its worst outbreak in two years. Of the total cases, Jilin province reported the highest at 1,412. Earlier, China locked down Jilin's provincial capital city Changchun over spike in COVID-19 cases.

345.title: For actors, performance trumps discomfort: Shruti on kissing Mugdha in show
345.article_body: Actress Shruti Seth, speaking about her on-screen kiss with Mugdha Godse in the upcoming series 'Bloody Brothers', said, "It was funny because both of us had never done a scene like it before." "Shaad (Ali, director) really put us at ease. And then for actors, the performance trumps discomfort so we eventually made it seem totally natural," she added.

346.title: Religious fanaticism, communal hysteria rising in country: RSS
346.article_body: Religious fanaticism and acts of communal hysteria are being spread in the country under the cover of the Constitution and religious freedom, the RSS said in its annual report. "Efforts are afoot to weaken the society by rising various fissiparous tendencies in the Hindu society itself," RSS said in the report.

347.title: Always rated you as a talented bowler with a lot of skills: Sachin to Sreesanth
347.article_body: After Sreesanth announced his retirement from all forms of Indian domestic cricket, Sachin Tendulkar took to Instagram to congratulate the fast bowler.
