He wrote, "Always rated you as a talented bowler with a lot of skills. Congratulations @sreesanthnair36, on representing India over the years.  All the very best for your 2nd innings."

348.title: Posters criticising Venugopal surface in Kerala after Cong's defeat
348.article_body: Following Congress' defeat in Assembly polls, posters criticising party leader KC Venugopal have surfaced near a party office in Kerala's Kannur. The posters read- "Save Congress- thanks to Venugopal for what happened in five states where Congress was wiped out". State Congress chief K Sudhakaran reacted to this saying that everyone has a "collective responsibility for successes and failures".

349.title: Sonia, Rahul should discharge their duties properly: JD(U) chief
349.article_body: Janata Dal (United) president Rajiv Ranjan alias Lalan Singh has asked senior Congress leaders, Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, to "discharge their duties properly" in order to "save the decline of Congress". He further asked Congress to "come out with a proper roadmap" in the backdrop of the party's defeat in the five states' assembly elections.

350.title: RCB have made the right choice in appointing Plessis as captain: Karthik
350.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said RCB have made the right choice in appointing Faf du Plessis as their captain for the upcoming season. "Faf is at that stage in his career when he's ready to take on the responsibility...he's a great tactician," stated Karthik, who'll also feature for the franchise this season. Karthik was bought by RCB for ₹5.5 crore.

351.title: People in Bollywood never saw me beyond my looks: Dino Morea
351.article_body: Actor Dino Morea in an interview said, "Being good looking sometimes works against you in Bollywood." "Directors don't see me differently. I just get...feedback that you're good looking...I find it...bizarre, what's my look got to do with casting me in a certain character. Just cast me. I can change my look," he said, adding, "People...never saw me beyond my looks."

352.title: CRPF jawan who was home on leave martyred in terror attack in J&K; 2 held
352.article_body: A 34-year-old CRPF jawan, who was home on leave, was martyred after terrorists fired upon him near his home in the Chotipora area of Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Saturday evening. "He succumbed to his injuries while on way to a hospital," a police spokesperson said. Kashmir IGP said two persons have been arrested in connection with the terror crime.

353.title: Congress' Dipika Pandey resigns post debacle in Uttarakhand polls
353.article_body: Congress' Jharkhand MLA Dipika Pandey Singh has resigned as the national secretary, co-in charge of Uttarakhand after the party failed to win the Uttarakhand assembly elections. Singh said in a tweet that she takes "responsibility for the defeat in Uttarakhand" and "thank the leadership for giving the opportunity to serve Congress at the national level".

354.title: WI fined 40% of match fee for slow over-rate against India in Women's WC
354.article_body: West Indies have been fined 40% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against India in their match in the ongoing Women's Cricket World Cup. WI were found to be two overs short of the target after time allowances were taken into consideration. India won the match by 155 runs to register their second win in three games.

355.title: 4 killed as tipper truck hits autorickshaw in Punjab's Mohali
355.article_body: Four persons were killed in a road accident on Kharar-Kurali road, Mohali, after a tipper truck hit an auto-rickshaw. The accident occurred on Friday when the victims were coming towards Kharar to board a train to go to their native place in UP's Badaun district. The truck was seized and the driver was arrested, police said.

356.title: Men sexually harass girl one by one during festival in MP, onlookers record videos
356.article_body: Several men sexually harassed a girl on a street in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur during Bhagoria festival, which is celebrated by tribal people. Police registered a case after a video surfaced online. In the video, the girl was heard screaming as men molested her one by one, and onlookers were seen recording videos with their phones instead of helping the girl.

357.title: Man rapes 11-year-old step daughter in Gurugram, threatens to kill her; arrested
357.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 11-year-old step daughter and threatening to kill her in Gurugram on Saturday. According to police, the girl's mother filed a police complaint against the accused. In the complaint, she said some time after her husband died six years ago, she had married the accused, who is a native of Nepal.

358.title: Bengaluru NCB seize 1.97 kg pseudoephedrine; 2 arrested
358.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau's (NCB) Bengaluru unit has seized 1.97 kg of pseudoephedrine from a consignment headed to New Zealand at a courier centre in the city, officers said. Two people, including a South African national, have also been arrested in the matter. The consignment had 50 spools of metallic yarn, with each concealing about 40 gm of the drug.

359.title: It's not often you see such knocks on turning tracks: Irfan on Shreyas' 92 vs SL
359.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised Shreyas Iyer for his 92-run knock during India's first innings in the ongoing Test against Sri Lanka. "It was an innings of the highest class...The control was because of the clarity of thought, whether to play forward or back...You won't get to see such knocks on turning tracks often," Irfan stated.

360.title: Mother of AAP's Labh Singh who defeated Punjab CM continues working as sweeper
360.article_body: Baldev Kaur, mother of AAP's Labh Singh Ugoke who won from Bhadaur seat by defeating Congress' CS Channi in Punjab polls, continues to work as a sweeper at a government school in Ugoke village. "I take pride...that my son chose to join a party whose symbol is 'jhaadu', which I've used throughout my life to earn a livelihood," she said.

361.title: WI-Eng Test went on longer than needed, bit disrespectful: Carlos Brathwaite
361.article_body: West Indies all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite has criticised England, stating that they were a "bit disrespectful" by agreeing to a draw in the first Test against West Indies only in the final over of the game. "With two set batsmen playing...and pitch offering nothing, England still felt they could [win]...Would they have done that against India, New Zealand, Pakistan?" asked Brathwaite.

362.title: Posing as customer, man steals car during test drive in Ludhiana
362.article_body: A female employee of an auto agency was robbed at gunpoint by a man who posed as a customer and escaped with SUV he took for a test drive near Doraha, Ludhiana. The accused was captured in the CCTVs installed in the showroom and his face was covered with a mask, Sewa Singh, sub-inspector at Sahnewal Police Station, said.

363.title: Sikkim plans to install vending machines for free sanitary pads in all govt schools
363.article_body: The Sikkim government is set to announce a scheme to install vending machines to provide free sanitary pads in its 210 secondary and senior secondary schools. The state government aims to curb dropout of girl students from schools and raise awareness about menstrual hygiene. "We'll also install incinerators...for proper disposal of pads," state Education Department's Secretary-in-Charge said.

364.title: Denied entry, man stabs 2 women employees at New York museum
364.article_body: A man reportedly stabbed two women employees multiple times at New York City's Museum of Modern Art after he was denied entry since his membership had expired.  The victims were immediately taken to the hospital and are expected to survive. The police said that the perpetrator is known to them and they are trying to locate him.

365.title: Chinese plane crashed into South China Sea on March 1: Taiwan
365.article_body: Taiwan's National Security Bureau Director-General Chen Ming-tong has confirmed that a China's People's Liberation Army Air Force plane had crashed into the South China Sea on March 1, Taiwan News reported. The report also said that Taiwanese media noticed a "sudden drop off" in Y-8 flights through the country's air defence identification zone. China hasn't acknowledged the incident, it added.

366.title: People think therapy is useless, it helped me so much: Jacqueline
366.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has said people think therapy is useless but it helped her a lot. She added that she sought help from a therapist because she was "going through loneliness" in 2020 during the COVID-19 induced lockdown. "I had this amazing therapist. I was doing therapy for some time. And it is amazing," Jacqueline further said.

367.title: Deleted a scene featuring Abhishek, Chunky in 'Bachchhan Paandey': Director
367.article_body: 'Bachchhan Paandey' director Farhad Samji revealed that they've deleted a scene featuring pictures of Abhishek Bachchan and Chunky Panday in the upcoming film. "Kriti and Arshad's characters were looking for Bachchhan Paandey and they ask a...kid if they'd seen him. The kid said yes and pulled out...magazine with pictures of Abhishek and Chunky. We didn't put this scene," he said.

368.title: 21-year-old BMW driver arrested in hit and run case in Delhi after 1 killed
368.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly killed 36-year-old Rahul Chand in a hit and run accident by his BMW car, police said. The driver was held after the police traced him through the car's number plate details. "BMW is in the name of accused, Ashwani Lal, who lives in Indirapuram, Ghaziabad,” said DCP (east) Priyanka Kashyap.

369.title: New mayor appointed in Ukraine's Melitopol after predecessor kidnapped
369.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has appointed Galina Danilchenko as the new mayor of Melitopol city after the elected mayor Ivan Fedorov was reportedly kidnapped by the Russian military. The country's foreign ministry has condemned Fedorov's abduction, calling it a gross violation of international law and a war crime under the Geneva Conventions.

370.title: Many big names in Karnataka to join party soon: AAP's Prithvi Reddy
370.article_body: In four to six weeks, many big names in Karnataka will be joining the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), party leader Prithvi Reddy said while adding that an announcement for the same would be made soon. The party will identify candidates for next year's Assembly elections early so that they could work on their respective constituencies, Reddy added.

371.title: Paytm founder held, released on bail in Feb for ramming car into police vehicle
371.article_body: Paytm CEO and founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma was arrested and released on bail by Delhi Police last month after being booked for rash and negligent driving. A Jaguar Land Rover allegedly being driven by Sharma had rammed into vehicle of DCP (South district) outside The Mother’s International School on Aurobindo Marg. The police also impounded the car after the accident.

372.title: UK shares latest map of Ukraine showing areas controlled by Russia
372.article_body: The UK's Ministry of Defence has shared the latest map of Ukraine showing areas controlled by Russia. The Russian troops have surrounded Mariupol, a port city on the Sea of Azov and are close to cutting off the country's second-largest city Kharkiv. The map also shows the likely axis of advance of the Russian troops.

373.title: China reports highest COVID-19 cases in 2 years with more than 3,300 infections
373.article_body: China reported more than 3,300 COVID-19 infections on Saturday as the country faces its worst outbreak since the early days of the pandemic, Bloomberg reported. There were 1,807 confirmed local infections, 1,315 asymptomatic local cases and more than 200 imported cases, the National Health Commission said on Sunday. The northeastern province of Jilin accounted for more than 2,100 cases.

374.title: 19 cow carcasses found near railway track in Punjab; probe ordered
374.article_body: At least 19 headless cow carcasses, with their skins removed, have been found at an abandoned place near a railway track on Saturday in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, SP (Investigation) Mukhtiar Rai said. Following this, a two-member committee was formed to probe the matter. Political leaders also blocked traffic in a protest over the incident and lifted the blockade after police assurance.

375.title: Australia record their biggest win by runs against NZ in Women's World Cups
375.article_body: Australia recorded their biggest win (by runs) against New Zealand in Women's ODI World Cups after beating them by 141 runs in the ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup. Australia posted 269/8 in 50 overs and then restricted New Zealand to 128/10 in 30.2 overs with Darcie Brown picking three wickets. It's Australia's third straight win in the tournament.

376.title: Over 700 exotic birds kept in cages for illegal sale rescued in Tamil Nadu
376.article_body: Forest department officials in Tamil Nadu's Trichy conducted raids at various locations in a crackdown against illegal trade of exotic birds. Officials said over 600 green parrots and 100 starlings were kept in cages for sale in Trichy. The accused who were engaged in the illegal trade of exotic birds will be fined under Wild Life (Protection) Act, officials added.

377.title: One of the quicker bowlers has to be workhorse, Shami does that: Gavaskar
377.article_body: With India restricting Sri Lanka to 86/6 at stumps on Day 1 in the ongoing second Test, Sunil Gavaskar called Mohammad Shami a "workhorse", praising his ability to bowl long spells while maintaining pace. "Shami is somebody who can bowl long spells, sustain that pace, and can build pressure...You need somebody like that. He has been terrific," Gavaskar added.

378.title: India reports 3,116 new COVID-19 cases, 47 deaths in 24 hours
378.article_body: India has reported 3,116 new COVID-19 cases and 47 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 3,614 cases and 89 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 38,069, while the death toll in the country reached 5,15,850.

379.title: KTR warns of cutting power supply to Secunderabad military area
379.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration Minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday warned that water and power supply to the military authorities in the Secunderabad Cantonment area will be cut if they don't stop causing inconvenience to the people. It's "not fair" for the military authorities to close roads whenever they want, he added. A BJP spokesperson called Rao's remarks "shocking".

380.title: Holi celebrations to be held in Gr Noida City Park on March 16; entry free
380.article_body: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority will organise a two-hour long event to celebrate Holi in City Park on March 16. The event will be held from 5 pm to 7 pm and the entry will be free, said GNIDA. The event will feature Mathura's Charkula and Gagri dance recitals and a performance by Braj folk singer Dr Seema Morwal.

381.title: 4 members of inter-state drug peddling gang arrested in Ludhiana
381.article_body: The Ludhiana Police busted an inter-state drug peddling gang allegedly involved in the supply of ganja (cannabis), poppy husk and opium into Punjab. Police have arrested four members of the gang and claimed recovery of 2.04 quintals of ganja, 3 kg poppy husk and 500 grams of opium from them, allegedly smuggled from Odisha.

382.title: Assam man lynched, set on fire by mob for allegedly killing 5-yr-old child
382.article_body: A 35-year-old man, accused of killing a child, was allegedly lynched and later set on fire by a mob in a paddy field in Assam's Dibrugarh on Saturday. The incident took place after the accused allegedly stabbed a five-year-old child to death with a machete at a tea estate, police said. The mob attacked the accused with machetes and sticks.

383.title: Ronaldo breaks world record for scoring most goals in football history, claim Man Utd
383.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo scored a hat-trick for Manchester United against Tottenham Hotspur in Premier League on Saturday, taking his tally of professional goals for club and country to 807. As per Manchester United, Ronaldo broke the world record for scoring most goals in football history. Ronaldo surpassed late Austro-Czech footballer Josef Bican, who's estimated to have scored 805 goals by FIFA.

384.title: 12 missiles fired towards US consulate in Iraq from Iran: Officials
384.article_body: Twelve missiles were fired towards the US consulate in Iraq's northern city of Irbil on Sunday, Iraqi security officials said. A US defense official said missiles had been launched from neighbouring Iran. Another US official said there was no damage and no casualties at any US government facility, but Iraqi officials said several missiles had hit the US consulate.

385.title: People understood BJP should come to power if development is needed: Smriti Irani
385.article_body: After BJP’s victory in four of the five states where polls were held recently, Union Minister Smriti Irani said people understood that if they need development in the country, the BJP government should come to power. Reacting to Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav’s EVM allegation, Irani said that EVMs were just an excuse.

386.title: You can't play negative shots or just keep defending: Iyer on 92(98) vs SL
386.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer, who smashed 10 fours and 4 sixes in his 92-run knock to help India post 252 in their first innings against Sri Lanka, has said batting with a defensive mindset doesn't help on turning wickets. "My plan...was to cut down the spin (negate turn), so I decided to step out [while batting]," he added.

387.title: 'The Kashmir Files' makers Vivek Agnihotri, Abhishek Agarwal meet PM Modi
387.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' team, including director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, actress Pallavi Joshi and producer Abhishek Agarwal, met PM Narendra Modi on Saturday. Abhishek took to Twitter to share some pictures from the meeting and wrote, "It was a pleasure to meet our Hon'ble PM Shri Narendra Modi. What makes it more special is his...noble words about #TheKashmirFiles...Thank you, Modi Ji."

388.title: 21-yr-old DU graduate found hanging in Delhi; probe on
388.article_body: A 21-year-old man who graduated from Delhi University's Hansraj College was found hanging from a ceiling fan in Delhi's Vijay Nagar. The body was found by his flatmate and locals. The police said they didn't find any suicide note and started a probe. The man reportedly hailed from UP and had recently landed a job in Noida.

389.title: Pune police file 3,500-page chargesheet in MHADA paper leak case
389.article_body: Pune police have filed a 3,500-page chargesheet against the director of a private firm and two agents in connection with the Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority (MHADA) paper leak case. The three - Dr Pritesh Deshmukh, Ankush Harkal and Santosh Harkal - have been accused of seeking lakhs of rupees from candidates in a recruitment drive for 565 posts.

390.title: Chhattisgarh teacher comes to school drunk, beats students with bat; suspended
390.article_body: A school teacher in Chhattisgarh allegedly reached school drunk and beat the students with a cricket bat, according to the District Collector. Following the incident, the District Collector issued an order suspending the teacher with immediate effect. The incident took place on March 10, when the teacher arrived at the school after consuming liquor.

391.title: 20-yr-old Gr Noida man shoots sister dead for objecting to his drinking habits
391.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her 20-year-old brother at their residence in Greater Noida for objecting to his drinking habits. Police said the accused had come home intoxicated and had started puking when his sister scolded him. The accused, who had a pistol with him, started arguing with her and later escaped after shooting her dead.

392.title: Virat wants to enjoy his time at RCB as batsman, we respect that: Hesson
392.article_body: Talking about their decision to appoint Faf du Plessis as captain for the upcoming season, RCB's Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said it was clear that Virat Kohli wanted a break, which is why he stepped down as captain after last season. "Virat wants to enjoy his time as a batsman and we are very respectful of that," Hesson added.

393.title: Pune police arrest 2 cyber experts for misleading cryptocurrency probe
393.article_body: Pune police have arrested two cyber experts for allegedly misleading a probe into a cryptocurrency cheating case in which 17 people were arrested. The two, who were expected to assist police in the case, transferred seized cryptocurrency from national and international wallets to themselves and their partners, said police. One of them allegedly submitted manipulated screenshots to the police.

394.title: 2 assault watchman, steal ₹1.6 lakh-material from firm in Pune
394.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a 68-year-old watchman with a sharp weapon and a brick and then stealing material worth about ₹1.6 lakh from a steel firm in Pune. A police official said that the duo had apparently scaled the main gate to enter the premises and later opened the gate to let their other accomplices in.

395.title: Bengaluru traffic police officer helps 80-yr-old man find his home
395.article_body: Bengaluru's Rajajinagar Traffic Police Station on Sunday tweeted that a traffic police officer, who was on duty in the area, had helped an 80-year-old man who'd gone missing from his house. It said that the police officer had tracked down the man's home and contacted his family by phone. The traffic police station also shared a picture of the incident.

396.title: Ukraine shares 'Spider-Man' meme to show damaged Russian tank
396.article_body: The official Twitter account of Ukraine shared a 'Spider-Man' meme to show a damaged Russian tank. Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed over 12,000 Russian soldiers, destroyed 362 Russian tanks and 1,205 armoured vehicles of other types amid the war. Russia had started invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

397.title: Virat Kohli's gestures to Bengaluru crowd chanting 'RCB RCB' go viral
397.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli's gestures to the Bengaluru crowd chanting 'RCB RCB' during the second India-Sri Lanka Test have gone viral. Kohli was seen making a heart sign with his hands as the crowd chanted 'RCB RCB'. Kohli also pulled up his Team India shirt to reveal a red coloured apparel below it as the crowd chanted for RCB.

398.title: Mumbai psychologist held for selling brownies laced with hashish, opium denied bail
398.article_body: A special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) court has rejected a 24-year-old psychologist's bail plea, who was arrested with 10 kilograms of hashish-laden brownies. The accused was practising in a renowned hospital in south Mumbai. Mumbai's Narcotics Control Bureau unit claimed that the accused baked brownies with a mixture of hashish and opium and supplied them to several clients.

399.title: Satellite images show fires, damage to residential buildings in Ukraine
399.article_body: Satellite images showed damage to civilian infrastructure and residential buildings throughout the Ukrainian city of Mariupol. Maxar Technologies said fires were seen in the western section of the Black Sea port city and several high-rise buildings had been severely damaged. Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said Mariupol was besieged by Russian forces but was still under Ukrainian control.

400.title: Hailey Bieber hospitalised after suffering brain-related 'medical emergency'
400.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber, the wife of singer Justin Bieber, was reportedly hospitalised with a brain condition that could possibly be linked to COVID-19. As per reports, Hailey, who has been discharged, was admitted after suffering a "medical emergency" that affected the way she moved. A report claimed that 25-year-old Hailey showed symptoms that were more typical of an older person.

401.title: 31-year-old woman blown up by Russian tank as she went to get medicine for sick mother
401.article_body: A 31-year-old Ukrainian woman named Valeriia Maksetska, who was leaving her Kyiv home to collect medicine for her sick mother, was reportedly blown up by a Russian tank. She was allegedly killed alongside her mother and driver in a village near Kyiv. USAID administrator Samantha Power tweeted that they were waiting in a car for a Russian convoy to pass.

402.title: French woman alleges sexual abuse by Kerala tattoo artist accused in 6 other cases
402.article_body: A French national has alleged that she was sexually abused by Sujeesh PS who was arrested after several female clients accused him of crimes including rape. The woman claimed she was abused by Sujeesh in 2019 during a trip to Kochi, police said. Six cases were registered against him after an 18-year-old opened up about being raped by him.

403.title: Couldn't be happier to pass on baton: Kohli on Du Plessis as new RCB captain
403.article_body: Reacting to Faf du Plessis' appointment as the new RCB captain, Virat Kohli said he couldn't be "happier" to pass on the baton to a "good friend". He added, "We've been in touch for many years now...absolutely excited for him to lead RCB and to play under him." Kohli had stepped down as RCB's captain after IPL 2021.
